analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: yi ge gnyis pa snang ba dang 'dra ba ste /

analyzed: dper na yi ge da gcig snang bar gyur ba na de dang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi yi ge gnyis par snang ba med pa de dang 'dra bar ro //

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di yi ge rnams las ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de dag so so don med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yi ge gcig yod pa'i dus na yi ge gzhan med pas tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yi ge dag las dong zhan tshig la sogs pa 'gyur na /

analyzed: brdas byas pa'i bsdus pa de tsam gyis don rtogs /

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /

analyzed: yi ge dag las don rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;

analyzed: gal te yi ge dag las don rtogs par 'gyur ba de tshe /

analyzed: mtsho zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di las don ci 'dra bar rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di las kyang gyur te /

analyzed: 'gyur ba ma yin pa de bas na yi ge dag las don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: yi ge de dag ni dag gzhan dag la khyad par med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na gang gcig gi yi ge gang yin pa de dag nyid dag gzhan gyi ma yin te /

analyzed: skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol gyi bye brag gis dag so so la yi ge tha dad pa kho na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te dag gzhan la yang yi ge gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blos yi ge de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa yin la /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mtshungs pa lus la sogs pa dngos su ngo bo tha dad pa can rnams la yang 'dra bas 'khrul pa la snang ngo //

analyzed: dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir te / ngo shes pa la dpe nyid med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ngo shes par 'gyur ba gnyi ga la grub pa'i dpe gcig yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ngo shes pa ni sngon mthong ba'i dran pa bskyed par 'gyur ba na /

analyzed: rtag tu tha dad pa rnams ngo shes pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na dag so so la yi ge tha dad pa de dge nyid kyi khyad par las don rtogs pa'i khyad par yin no zhes bya ba der gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur na dbang po dang 'dra bar ngag ma mthong du zin kyang thag nye ba tsam gyis rtogs pa skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ngag thag nye ba tsam gyis rtogs pa skyed par khas len na ni ma byang ba'i yang ste /

analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: ngag med pa'i phyir yi ge 'ba' zhig lhag mar byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yi ge skyes bus ma byas par sgrub pa'i phyogs 'di la yongs su ngal ba don med pa yin no zhes bya @291b ba lan btab zin pa yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge de ga las don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i ngag yod pa ni bla ste /

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de / ngag de'i yan lag de dag kyang du ma yin na tha dad pa'i rang bzhin te /

analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because they are not to be benefited.

original: gzhan gyi phul du dbyung ba ma yin pa ni gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag gi phul du byung bar bya ba ma yin pa can rtag tu nus pa'i rang bzhin can nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phul du dbyung ba ma yin pa ni gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro // gzhan dag gi phul du byung bar bya ba ma yin pa can rtag tu nus pa'i rang bzhin can nam /
translated: It is not reasonable that what is not to be benefited by another should depend on that which benefits another.

original: nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If they are not to be made superior by others, they would always have the nature of being able or unable.

original: de nus pa'i rang bzhin can @296b rtag tu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'am skyed par mi byed pa'am gzhan zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nus pa'i rang bzhin can @296b rtag tu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'am skyed par mi byed pa'am gzhan zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It would be either always productive of an effect, because of its being by nature productive, or it would never be productive, or it would be by nature non-productive, i.e., unproductive.

original: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa de dag kyang thogs par byed pa rtsig pa la sogs pa des gang gi tshe chod par ma gyur pa de'i tshe phan tshun 'dogs par byed pa yin no//
analyzed: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa de dag kyang thogs par byed pa rtsig pa la sogs pa des gang gi tshe chod par ma gyur pa de'i tshe phan tshun 'dogs par byed pa yin no//
translated: And those objects, faculties, etc., are mutually contributory when they are not obstructed by a wall, etc., which would intervene between them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bar du gcod pa med pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because of the capacity of the unobstructed field, etc.

original: yul gang du bar du gcod par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni bar du gcod pa med pa can gyi yul lo //
analyzed: yul gang du bar du gcod par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa de ni bar du gcod pa med pa can gyi yul lo //
translated: The field is unobstructed when there is no obstruction in the field.

original: de'i rung ba nyid de nus pa gang yin pa de'i lhan cig byed kyis yul la sogs pa de dag phan tshun phul du byung ba skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rung ba nyid de nus pa gang yin pa de'i lhan cig byed kyis yul la sogs pa de dag phan tshun phul du byung ba skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The capacity of that is its fitness. The faculties, etc., are mutually contributory because of the fitness of the capacity of the unobstructed field, etc., to produce the special effect.

original: snang ba la sogs pa de dag la yang rtsig pa la sogs pas byas pa'i bar chad yod na ni bar du gcod par byed pa can gyi yul rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu med par nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan mi skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa de dag la yang rtsig pa la sogs pas byas pa'i bar chad yod na ni bar du gcod par byed pa can gyi yul rung ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu med par nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan mi skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir
translated: If there is an obstruction such as a wall in the visual field and so on, then the cause of the arising of another moment of potential is absent, because the cause of the arising of another moment of potential is the object that has the characteristic of being suitable to be the object of obstruction.

original: nus pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore consciousness such as visual consciousness does not arise.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar skad cig ma rnams ni dus thams cad du rang gi ngo bo gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar skad cig ma rnams ni dus thams cad du rang gi ngo bo gcig gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since moments do not always follow the same nature,

original: sngar 'byung ba'i nus pa dbang po la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rang gi dang kho nas 'gags pa'i phyir sgrib g-yogs rtsig pa yong na yang nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed par 'dod pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu med pas mi skyed pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: sngar 'byung ba'i nus pa dbang po la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rang gi dang kho nas 'gags pa'i phyir sgrib g-yogs rtsig pa yong na yang nus pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyed par 'dod pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rgyu med pas mi skyed pa'i phyir ro
translated: the potential that previously arose is blocked by the momentariness of the sense faculty and so on. Therefore, even if there is an obstruction such as a wall, another moment of potential does not arise, because the cause of the previously explained potential does not exist.

original: // shes pa'i rgyu bral ba ste rgyu dang bral ba de bas na rtsig ba la sogs pa yod pa'i yul bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // shes pa'i rgyu bral ba ste rgyu dang bral ba de bas na rtsig ba la sogs pa yod pa'i yul bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is free from the cause of cognition, i.e., since it is devoid of a cause, therefore, the cognition of a pot, etc., which exists in a place obstructed by a wall, etc., is not produced.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa la sgrib g-yogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa la sgrib g-yogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a wall, etc., is said to be an obstruction.

original: sngar rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba bum pa la sogs ba gegs byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba bum pa la sogs ba gegs byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it previously was suitable to produce cognition, but then a pot, etc., obstructs it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa thag nye ba na yod du zin kyang bum pa la sogs pa rung ba'i rang bzhin las ma 'phos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa thag nye ba na yod du zin kyang bum pa la sogs pa rung ba'i rang bzhin las ma 'phos pa'i phyir //
translated: Because, even though it exists in close proximity to a wall, etc., the suitability of a pot, etc., does not move from its own nature.

original: nus pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa nyid yin la nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: nus pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa nyid yin la nus pa med pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: That which is capable is just capable, and that which is incapable is just incapable.

original: rang bzhin gcig la gnas ba ni nus pa dang nus pa ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig la gnas ba ni nus pa dang nus pa ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not tenable that a single nature is both capable and incapable. This is the meaning.

original: de bas na 'di ltar skad cig ma rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas phul du byung bar byed pa ma yin na yang sgrib par byed par rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar skad cig ma rnams la ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas phul du byung bar byed pa ma yin na yang sgrib par byed par rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the arising of things is obstructed in this way, even though the moments are not producers in the way that has been explained.

original: sgra rtag pa la ni ma yin no //üîΩda ni rtsig pa la sogs pas kyang bum pa la @297a * //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa la ni ma yin no // da ni rtsig pa la sogs pas kyang bum pa la @297a * //
translated: But it is not so for a permanent sound.

original: sogs pa dag gi phul du byung bar byed do zhes brjod pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa dag gi phul du byung bar byed do zhes brjod pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to state that even walls, etc., are producers of pots, etc., he says, ‚ÄúOr, even though existing in a thing, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po bum pa la sogs pa la yod du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po bum pa la sogs pa la yod du zin kyang ngo //
translated: Even though existing in a thing, such as a pot, etc.,

original: ji lta bur gyur pa dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa dag gi zhe na /
translated: What kind of things?

original: skad cig ma rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The moments mutually assist each other.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes 'dir don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa yod du zin kyang zhes 'dir don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Even though assistance by walls, etc., exists, this is what is meant here.

original: lhan cig byed pas phan 'dogs pa la ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas phan 'dogs pa la ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is not the slightest assistance by a co-operating cause.

original: gal te sgrib g-yogs kyis byas pa'i phan btags pa yang yod par 'gyur na ci'i phyir nye bar rtogs pa med /
analyzed: gal te sgrib g-yogs kyis byas pa'i phan btags pa yang yod par 'gyur na ci'i phyir nye bar rtogs pa med /
translated: If there were an obstruction that was helpful, why would there be no apprehension?

original: nye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba med na yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar rtogs par 'gyur ba med na yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If there were no apprehension, it would not exist.

original: tshul rol mthong ba rnams kyis nye bar rtogs pa med pa la de med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul rol mthong ba rnams kyis nye bar rtogs pa med pa la de med pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who see the truth do not apprehend it as nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of causes and conditions is inconceivable.

original: gang gis shes na thams cad shes pa ma yin te tshu rol mthong bas so //
analyzed: gang gis shes na thams cad shes pa ma yin te tshu rol mthong bas so //
translated: If it were known, it would not be all-knowing, because it would be limited to what is seen.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na gal te dbang po dang yul gyi bar na gnas pa'i sgrib g-yogs des dbang po dang yul de dag la rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i bye brag rnam pa 'ga' zhig
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na gal te dbang po dang yul gyi bar na gnas pa'i sgrib g-yogs des dbang po dang yul de dag la rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i bye brag rnam pa 'ga' zhig
translated: Therefore, if that obstruction between the sense faculty and object were to produce a consciousness in those sense faculties and objects, it would be something that is very incompatible with them,

original: gis phul du byung ba can byed du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: gis phul du byung ba can byed du zin kyang ngo //
translated: and it would be something that is superior to them.

original: yang gi sgras ni srid pa yin te 'di la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni srid pa yin te 'di la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is existence, because there is no harm to it.

original: sgrib g-yogs kyis byas pa'i phan btags pa la rtags kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs kyis byas pa'i phan btags pa la rtags kyang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also taught that there is a sign of the benefit that is made by obscuration.

original: sgrib g-yogs kyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs kyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúBy the difference in obscuration, etc.‚Äù

original: rna ba'i dbang po'am sgra'i sgrib g-yogs gang yin pa de'i bye brag gis te /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po'am sgra'i sgrib g-yogs gang yin pa de'i bye brag gis te /
translated: It is by the difference in the obscuration of the ear faculty or of sound.

original: mang po dang nyung du'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: mang po dang nyung du'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: It is by the difference in the characteristics of many or few.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i sgra ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúsound, etc.‚Äù include form, etc.

original: mnyan pa smos pa ni nyams su myong ba nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan pa smos pa ni nyams su myong ba nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúhearing‚Äù is for the purpose of illustrating experience.

original: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because of the clarity or unclarity of the eye consciousnesses, one sees, respectively, clearly or unclearly.

original: de ltar na shes pa la sogs pa sa chod pa la ni mi gsal gos la sogs pas chod pa la ni mi gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa la sogs pa sa chod pa la ni mi gsal gos la sogs pas chod pa la ni mi gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one sees clearly when there is no obstruction by consciousness, etc., and one sees unclearly when there is obstruction by obscuration, etc.

original: gal te sgrib g-yogs srab pa la yang cung zad yin na yang gdon mi za bar gsal bar bsam par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgrib g-yogs srab pa la yang cung zad yin na yang gdon mi za bar gsal bar bsam par bya ba yin nam /
translated: If it is slightly obscured, it is also slightly clear. But is it definitely clear when it is not obscured at all?

original: de ltar sgrib g-yogs yod du zin kyang thos @297b pa gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sgrib g-yogs yod du zin kyang thos @297b pa gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though it is obscured, it is clear when it is heard.

original: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault in this explanation,

original: sgrib g-yogs mthug pa mi gsal ba gang yin pa de la ltos nas gsal ba bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs mthug pa mi gsal ba gang yin pa de la ltos nas gsal ba bstan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that it is clear in relation to that which is not clear due to thick obscuration.

original: gzhan dag ni sgrib g-yogs kyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba sgrib g-yogs yod pa dang med pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgrib g-yogs kyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba sgrib g-yogs yod pa dang med pa la 'chad de /
translated: Others explain that the phrase ‚Äúdue to the difference in obscuration‚Äù refers to the presence or absence of obscuration.

original: sgrib g-yogs yod bas mnyan pa mi gsal ba med pas gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs yod bas mnyan pa mi gsal ba med pas gsal ba yin no //
translated: It is clear when it is heard without obscuration, and it is not clear when it is heard with obscuration.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te sgrib g-yogs kyis khyad par mi byed pa de'i tshe cung zhig mi byed pa'i sgrib g-yogs de ni thag nye ba gang yin pa de thag nye ba nyid yin du zin kyang thag nye ba ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te sgrib g-yogs kyis khyad par mi byed pa de'i tshe cung zhig mi byed pa'i sgrib g-yogs de ni thag nye ba gang yin pa de thag nye ba nyid yin du zin kyang thag nye ba ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i
translated: If it were otherwise, if obscuration did not make a difference, then that obscuration which does not do anything at all would be distant, even though it is near, and it would be as if it were not near.

original: phyir / sgra 'di'i sgrib g-yogs 'di yin no zhes nye bar sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: phyir / sgra 'di'i sgrib g-yogs 'di yin no zhes nye bar sbyar ba ste /
translated: The word only is added to this, meaning that this is the obscuration of this word.

original: 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa nyid yin gyi dngos po la brten pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pas sprul pa nyid yin gyi dngos po la brten pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: The connection is just the creation of a concept, not based on an entity.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa yin du zin kyang don byed pa'i rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa yin du zin kyang don byed pa'i rten du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is a superimposition by a concept, it becomes the basis for the performance of an object.

original: sgro btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, The superimposition...

original: sgro btags pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: It has the nature of following a superimposition.

original: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don gyi rten can ni don byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sgro btags pa'i don gyi rten can ni don byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The basis of the object of a superimposition by a concept does not perform an object.

original: de dag ni dngos po la brten pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po la brten pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on an entity.

original: bram ze'i khye'u zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: The phrase the young brahmin... and so on establishes that very point.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar btags pa las te /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la mer nye bar btags pa las te /
translated: It is from the superimposition of fire on the young brahmin.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes nye bar btags pa las bsgrub par bya ba 'tshed pa'i phyir rten pa ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la me zhes nye bar btags pa las bsgrub par bya ba 'tshed pa'i phyir rten pa ma yin pa lta bu'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, the boy of the brahmin is not designated as fire because of cooking.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de bas na rtogs pa yod du zin kyang dngos po der yongs su 'gyur ba can ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de bas na rtogs pa yod du zin kyang dngos po der yongs su 'gyur ba can ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: If that is so, then even though there is understanding, those things are not transformed by that,

original: gang dag la rtogs pas bsgyur ba'i yod pa de dag ni des yongs su bsgyur ba can no //
analyzed: gang dag la rtogs pas bsgyur ba'i yod pa de dag ni des yongs su bsgyur ba can no //
translated: because those things that are transformed by understanding are transformed by that.

original: de med pa'i phyir des yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa can dag go //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir des yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa can dag go //
translated: Those things that are not transformed by that are not transformed by that because that does not exist.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: However, they would be just as they are by nature.

original: gang la rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Those things that are just as they are by nature are said to exist.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro//
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: gang gi tshe sgrib g-yogs kyis khyad par du ma byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgrib g-yogs kyis khyad par du ma byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they are not distinguished by obscuration,

original: sgrib g-yogs yod du zin kyang dbang po la sogs pa dag gis shes par 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs yod du zin kyang dbang po la sogs pa dag gis shes par 'gyur na ste /
translated: If, even though there is an obstruction, consciousness were to arise from the sense faculties, etc.,

analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no // de bas na sgrib g-yogs des byas pa'i khyad par can te bskyed par bya ba khyad @298a * // par can dbang po la sogs pa de ltar shes par 'gyur ro // de ltar na sgra rtag pa rnams sgrib g-yogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig yod na yang phul du byung ba nyams pa'am / phul du byung ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then that would be the case, but it is not.

analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe skyes bu 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa cung zhig kyang skyed par mi 'gyur bar de nges pa yin no //
translated: At some times, it is certain that some person will not produce any consciousness at all.

original: sgra rtag pa yang dus thams cad du gal te lhan cig byed pa 'ga' dang bral ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa yang dus thams cad du gal te lhan cig byed pa 'ga' dang bral ba'i phyir na /
translated: And sound is permanent, but if it is devoid of any co-operation at all times,

original: mnyan pa med do de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: mnyan pa med do de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: then it is not heard. He explains this in the passage beginning ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: sgrib g-yogs kyi rgyu las skyes bu thams cad kyi rtag tu sgra thams cad ma thos pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs kyi rgyu las skyes bu thams cad kyi rtag tu sgra thams cad ma thos pa ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not that all people never hear any sound at all because of the cause of obstruction.

original: 'on kyang sgra rtag pa de dag rtogs pa la ste rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig byed pa so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gis dngos po'i gnas skabs kyis nges pa'i ngo bo cung zad ni yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra rtag pa de dag rtogs pa la ste rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan lhan cig byed pa so sor nges pa 'ga' zhig gis dngos po'i gnas skabs kyis nges pa'i ngo bo cung zad ni yod do //
translated: However, there is some definite nature of the state of affairs that is the cause of the ascertainment of that permanent sound, that is, the reason for the ascertainment, by some definite co-operation.

original: lhan cig byed pa de ni 'ga' zhig gir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sgra de dag 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul 'ga' zhig tu nges par byas pa ste lhan cig byed pas byas pa thos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa de ni 'ga' zhig gir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sgra de dag 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul 'ga' zhig tu nges par byas pa ste lhan cig byed pas byas pa thos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúsome‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe word is produced by some‚Äù refers to the fact that the word is heard when it is produced by some particular combination of conditions.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Proponent of the True Nature of Things says, ‚ÄúIf that is so . . .

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni khas len pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni khas len pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means ‚Äúif you accept that.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, ‚Äúif that is the case.‚Äù

original: lhan cig byed pa gzhan ltos yin yang blo ste ltos pa yin du chug na yang mi ldog mod kyi /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gzhan ltos yin yang blo ste ltos pa yin du chug na yang mi ldog mod kyi /
translated: Even if the word is produced by some other combination of conditions, and even if the word is dependent, it is not the case that the word is not refuted.

original: 'on kyang de ltar yin na ni nges pa dag gi 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar yin na ni nges pa dag gi 'gal ba yin te /
translated: However, if that is the case, then the word is contradictory to the thesis.

original: lhan cig byed pas phul du dbyung ba byas pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas phul du dbyung ba byas pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the word is produced by some other combination of conditions, and because the word is dependent.

original: sgra ni snga ma'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra ni snga ma'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thesis ‚Äúthe word remains in its previous nature‚Äù is not established.

original: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúWe do not deny that causes have assistants.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag ni rgyu rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa dag spong ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgyu rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa dag spong ba ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: We do not deny that causes have assistants.

original: 'on kyang rgyu rnams lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu rnams lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, causes do depend on assistants.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig la zhe na /
translated: What kind of assistants do they have?

original: de'i gnas skabs la phan 'dogs par byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs la phan 'dogs par byed pa dag ste /
translated: They have assistants that benefit them.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs la phan 'dogs par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs la phan 'dogs par byed pa la'o //
translated: They benefit the state that is the nature of producing the desired effect.

original: @298b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @298b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lhan cig byed pa de las rnyed pa'i phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir te 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa de las rnyed pa'i phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir te 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are applied to the effect that is obtained from those assistants, that is, because they produce the effect.

original: de ltar na gal te rig byed kyi sgra dag kyang lhan cig byed pa 'ga' zhig la ltos nas 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te rig byed kyi sgra dag kyang lhan cig byed pa 'ga' zhig la ltos nas 'bras bu ste /
translated: Thus, if the sounds of the Vedas also depend on some assistants to produce their effect, then they are like other effects.

original: bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa byed par 'gyur na byed la rag ste su zhig 'gog par byed /
analyzed: bdag gi yul can gyi shes pa byed par 'gyur na byed la rag ste su zhig 'gog par byed /
translated: If it is the case that the cognition that has the object as its object is produced, then it is produced. Who can stop it?

original: 'on kyang snga ma'i rang bzhin snga ma nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma'i rang bzhin snga ma nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that the prior nature remains just as it is.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin de ni 'phos pa'i phyir dang ltos par bya ba lhan cig byed pa las rang bzhin gzhan snga na med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin de ni 'phos pa'i phyir dang ltos par bya ba lhan cig byed pa las rang bzhin gzhan snga na med pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the prior nature is displaced, and it obtains a different nature from the prior one, which is not present, due to the dependence on the cooperating conditions.

original: gal te yang ltos par bya ba lhan cig byed pa las sgras phul du byung ba thob pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang ltos par bya ba lhan cig byed pa las sgras phul du byung ba thob pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if sound does not obtain excellence due to the dependence on the cooperating conditions,

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: then it is not dependent on the cooperating conditions. This has already been explained.

original: ci ste lhan cig byed pa'i 'bad rtsol las sgras phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba thob pa yin na zhes khas len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig byed pa'i 'bad rtsol las sgras phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du 'gyur ba thob pa yin na zhes khas len pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is accepted that sound obtains a different object of benefit due to the exertion of the cooperating conditions,

original: lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i'o //
translated: then it is produced by the cooperating conditions.

original: phan 'dogs sgra las don gzhan nyid yin par khas len na sgra de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel pa med par ngas bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan 'dogs sgra las don gzhan nyid yin par khas len na sgra de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel pa med par ngas bshad zin to //
translated: If you accept that the benefit is something other than the sound, then I have already explained that there is no connection between the sound and the benefit that it produces.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gal te 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las sgras byas pa'i phan 'dogs par rtog pa de'i tshe de la yang gzhan dang de la'ang gzhan zhes bya ba'i thug pa med pa'i skyon la sogs
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gal te 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las sgras byas pa'i phan 'dogs par rtog pa de'i tshe de la yang gzhan dang de la'ang gzhan zhes bya ba'i thug pa med pa'i skyon la sogs
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that if you think that the benefit produced by the sound is produced by the cooperating conditions because the connection is established, then the same error of infinite regress would apply to that benefit: ‚ÄúThat benefit has another benefit, and that benefit has another benefit.‚Äù

original: pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: And so on.

original: sgra de yang shes bya ma yin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra de yang shes bya ma yin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the sound would not be an object of knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lhan cig byed pas byas don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phan 'dogs pa nyid las shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas byas don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phan 'dogs pa nyid las shes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition is produced from the benefit that is produced by the cooperating conditions and that is something other than the sound.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pas sgra de dag rna ba zhes bya ba'i dbang po dang / don dag phrad pa dang / bdag nyid ces bya ba de dag ni gzhan la rab tu grags pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pas sgra de dag rna ba zhes bya ba'i dbang po dang / don dag phrad pa dang / bdag nyid ces bya ba de dag ni gzhan la rab tu grags pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, the ear faculty, the contact of the object, and the self are well known to others, so they are explained.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to effort, etc.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa la zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa la zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rten rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rten rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i lhan cig byed pa la'o //
translated: In the support that produces consciousness, in the co-arising of consciousness.

original: sgra rtag pa de la lhan cig byed pa thams cad ni nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa de la lhan cig byed pa thams cad ni nye bar mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all co-arising is not applied to that permanent sound.

original: gzhan yang yi ge la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sgra de dag khyab par byed pa'am khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur grang ste rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yi ge la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sgra de dag khyab par byed pa'am khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur grang ste rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, those sounds that are the nature of letters, etc. would be either pervasive or not pervasive, because there is no other way.

original: gal te de dag khyab byed @299a * //
analyzed: gal te de dag khyab byed @299a * //
translated: If they are not pervasive,

original: min pa de'i tshe sgra de dag ni yul thams cad la ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: min pa de'i tshe sgra de dag ni yul thams cad la ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then those sounds would not be observed in all places.

original: de ltar na yul gcig la gnas pa'i sgra des stong pa'i yul la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yul gcig la gnas pa'i sgra des stong pa'i yul la gnas pa ste /
translated: Thus, the sound that exists in one place exists in a place devoid of that sound.üîΩ

original: sgras stong pa'i yul la gnas pa'i skyes bus ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgras stong pa'i yul la gnas pa'i skyes bus ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, how could a person who is in a place devoid of sound, that is, in a place devoid of sound, apprehend sound?

original: dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be apprehended.

original: dpyod pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi aa la sogs pa gcig yin par khas blangs pa de gal te khyab pa ma yin na yul tha dad pa na gnas pas ji ltar dmigs par te /
analyzed: dpyod pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi aa la sogs pa gcig yin par khas blangs pa de gal te khyab pa ma yin na yul tha dad pa na gnas pas ji ltar dmigs par te /
translated: If the grammarians and logicians assert that the letter a and so on are one, but not pervasive, then how could it be apprehended by someone in a different place?

original: dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would not be apprehended.

original: gal te ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that this fault does not exist in the position that apprehends without contact,

original: sgra la phrad pa nyid rna bas 'dzin pa de bas na /
analyzed: sgra la phrad pa nyid rna bas 'dzin pa de bas na /
translated: then since the ear apprehends sound through contact,

original: sgras stong pa'i yul la gnas pas kyang sgra 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mi dmigs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgras stong pa'i yul la gnas pas kyang sgra 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mi dmigs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then even someone in a place devoid of sound would apprehend sound, and the fault would arise that nothing would be unapprehended.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: ma phrad pa'i 'dzin pa'i phyogs de la yang shin tu chod pas na gnas pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma phrad pa'i 'dzin pa'i phyogs de la yang shin tu chod pas na gnas pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And since it is also very clear that the position of the apprehension of non-contact is not tenable, therefore the abiding is not in the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yul rung ba nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yul rung ba nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: Because the abiding is in the proper domain.

original: sgra de'i gnas pa de'i khyad par can la dbang po ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de'i gnas pa de'i khyad par can la dbang po ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sense faculty depends on the abiding of the sound, which is characterized by that.

original: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rdo khab len dang sogs pa dang 'dra bas te /
analyzed: rdo khab len dang sogs pa dang 'dra bas te /
translated: It is like a magnet, etc.

original: dper na rdo khab len ma phrad par 'dren par byed pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: dper na rdo khab len ma phrad par 'dren par byed pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: For example, even though a magnet attracts without contact,

original: yul rung ba ma yin pa na gnas pa'i lcags 'dren pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yul rung ba ma yin pa na gnas pa'i lcags 'dren pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: it does not attract iron that is not in the proper domain. It is like that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sprul gdugs pa la sogs pa dag gis ma phrad pa dag gis sgron ma la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sprul gdugs pa la sogs pa dag gis ma phrad pa dag gis sgron ma la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: The word etc. includes such things as a poisonous snake, etc. Even though they harm without contact,

original: shin tu bskal pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa'i sgron ma la sogs pa 'joms par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: they do not harm a lamp, etc. that is too far away.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sgra yul rung ba nyid na gnas pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po ltos pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sgra yul rung ba nyid na gnas pa de 'dzin par byed pa'i dbang po ltos pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: if sound were to be apprehended when it abides in a suitable place, and if the sense faculty were independent, then

original: yul rung ba nyid la gnas pa khyad par can gyi bye brag gis thos pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul rung ba nyid la gnas pa khyad par can gyi bye brag gis thos pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: when sound abides in a suitable place, there would be no difference of clarity or lack of clarity in hearing due to the difference of a special particular of the suitable place.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa de yin pa de ltar na thos pa dang ma thos pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa de yin pa de ltar na thos pa dang ma thos pa'i khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the example. In that case, there would be no difference of hearing and not hearing.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gal te de dag khyab byed min //
analyzed: gal te de dag khyab byed min //
translated: if they are not pervasive,

original: thams cad la ni dmigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad la ni dmigs mi 'gyur //
translated: then all would not be observed.

original: zhes bya ba der gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der gnas so //
translated: That is the point.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te 'di ltar sgra rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen gnas dang byed pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod na yang yul thams @299b cad la sgra mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba de bas na khyab par byed pa ma yin par yin
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te 'di ltar sgra rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen gnas dang byed pa'i bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod na yang yul thams @299b cad la sgra mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba de bas na khyab par byed pa ma yin par yin
translated: It is not so. Even though the objective conditions of sounds exist, such as the place and the action of the agent, sound is not observed equally in all places. Therefore, they are not pervasive.

original: no // ci ste khyab par byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra de dag gal te khyab na thams cad kyis te /
analyzed: no // ci ste khyab par byed par 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra de dag gal te khyab na thams cad kyis te /
translated: If you assert that sound pervades space, then all sounds would be simultaneously apprehended by all people.

original: skyes bu thams cad kyi sgra thams cad kyis sgra thams cad cig car dmigs pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad kyi sgra thams cad kyis sgra thams cad cig car dmigs pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: That is, all sounds would be simultaneously apprehended by all people.

original: sgra 'ga' zhig yul 'ga' zhig la yang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra 'ga' zhig yul 'ga' zhig la yang med pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that some sounds do not exist in some places,

original: khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the assertion of their pervasiveness.

original: phyir te gtan tshigs kyi sgra thams cad cig car dmigs par 'gyur ba yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i skyes bu dag gis cig car dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir te gtan tshigs kyi sgra thams cad cig car dmigs par 'gyur ba yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i skyes bu dag gis cig car dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the sound of the reason would be simultaneously apprehended by all people, and all people in all places would simultaneously apprehend it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyes bu dag dbang po rung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang yul sgra rang bzhin can rtag par 'gyur ba khyab par byed pa nyid du thams cad la nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dag dbang po rung ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang yul sgra rang bzhin can rtag par 'gyur ba khyab par byed pa nyid du thams cad la nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because people have unimpaired faculties and because the object, sound, is permanent and pervades all places.

original: thag nye ba nyid kyi phyir dang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang phul du byung ba byar med pa can la gegs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thag nye ba nyid kyi phyir dang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang phul du byung ba byar med pa can la gegs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is close, because it is permanent, and because there is no obstruction to the production of the best.

original: sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas pa dmigs pa de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas pa dmigs pa de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If sound is a product, and is perceived by the sense faculty when it is in good condition, then the previously mentioned error does not occur.üîΩTo respond:

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúa product‚Äù and so on.

original: las byed pa po'i drug pa yin no //
analyzed: las byed pa po'i drug pa yin no //
translated: The sixth case is the object of the action.

original: de bas na don ni sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas bas dmigs par khas len pa na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don ni sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas bas dmigs par khas len pa na ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this: If you accept that sound is a product, and is perceived by the sense faculty when it is in good condition, then the previously mentioned error does not occur.üîΩIn response, Vasubandhu states:

original: lan du / 'gyur med gang gis legs par byed//üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du / 'gyur med gang gis legs par byed// ces bya ba smos te /
translated: By what unchanging thing is it made to be in good condition?

original: sgra bsgyur du med pa gang gis legs par byed de /
analyzed: sgra bsgyur du med pa gang gis legs par byed de /
translated: By what unchanging thing is it made to be in good condition?

original: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: By nothing at all.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúIf it were not so,‚Äù and so on.

original: dus thams cad na sgra thams cad du yod du zin kyang skyes bu thams cad kyis dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad na sgra thams cad du yod du zin kyang skyes bu thams cad kyis dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though sound exists at all times, it is not perceived by all beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas pa kho nas dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra 'dus byas pa dbang po legs par byas pa kho nas dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because sound that is a product is perceived only by a well-functioning sense faculty.

original: de'i tshe 'dus byas pa dmigs pa'i phyir sgra thams cad dmigs par mi 'gyur zhing thams cad cig car legs par byas pa med pa'i phyir dbang po legs par byas pas dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dus byas pa dmigs pa'i phyir sgra thams cad dmigs par mi 'gyur zhing thams cad cig car legs par byas pa med pa'i phyir dbang po legs par byas pas dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: At that time, because it is a product, it is not perceived as all sound, and because it is not all sound that is well-functioning simultaneously, it is perceived by a well-functioning sense faculty.üîΩThat is the idea.

original: de ltar 'dod pa de la re zhig sgra 'dus byas pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa de la re zhig sgra 'dus byas pa ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In that view, sound that is a product is not perceived.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin pa can gyi sgra ni 'dus byas par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin pa can gyi sgra ni 'dus byas par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sound that is not to be transformed is not suitable as a product.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir phul du dbyung bar bya ba yod pa can gyi dbang po ni legs par byas par 'gyur ba yin pa de la yang dbang po legs par byas 'gyur na /üîΩ@300a * // dbang po legs par byas pa des kyang ma lus par thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir phul du dbyung bar bya ba yod pa can gyi dbang po ni legs par byas par 'gyur ba yin pa de la yang dbang po legs par byas 'gyur na / @300a * // dbang po legs par byas pa des kyang ma lus par thos par 'gyur te /
translated: And when the faculties are well refined,

original: sgra ma lus pa dag go //
analyzed: sgra ma lus pa dag go //
translated: then by those well refined faculties, all sounds are heard.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that with ‚ÄúThere, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te dbang po legs par byas pas dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dbang po legs par byas pas dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If, because of the well refined faculties, the object is perceived,

original: dbang po legs par ma byas pa can gyi skyes bus dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe thob par byed de /
analyzed: dbang po legs par ma byas pa can gyi skyes bus dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe thob par byed de /
translated: then the person whose faculties are not well refined does not perceive it.

original: gang gi tshe dbang po legs par byas pa des sgra thams cad cig car thos par 'gyur ba de ltar na thal bar 'gyur ba snga ma nyid kyis ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang po legs par byas pa des sgra thams cad cig car thos par 'gyur ba de ltar na thal bar 'gyur ba snga ma nyid kyis ma log pa yin no //
translated: When by those well refined faculties all sounds are heard simultaneously, then the former consequence is not averted.

original: yul tha dad pa la ltos pa'i dbang po legs par byas pa'i khyad par so sor nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na yul so so la gal te legs byas khyad par las /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa la ltos pa'i dbang po legs par byas pa'i khyad par so sor nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na yul so so la gal te legs byas khyad par las /
translated: The sense faculties that rely on different objects are definitely distinct due to the distinction of their proper functioning. Therefore, if the sense faculties are distinct due to the distinction of their proper functioning with regard to each object,

original: dbang po tha dad phyir don gcig nges pa yin te sgra gcig nyid 'dzin pa yin na'o //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad phyir don gcig nges pa yin te sgra gcig nyid 'dzin pa yin na'o //
translated: then the object is ascertained as being one due to the distinction of the sense faculties, and it is apprehended as being one sound.

original: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni /üîΩsgra'i 'dus pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yin na ni / sgra'i 'dus pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: If that were the case,üîΩhow could one hear a cacophony of sounds,

original: sgra'i tshogs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sgra ca co ji ltar thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra'i tshogs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sgra ca co ji ltar thos par 'gyur te /
translated: which is a collection of various sounds?

original: mi 'gyur na yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi 'gyur na yang mthong ngo //
translated: One would not hear it, but one does hear it.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: If one says ‚Äúwhy is that?‚Äù and so on,

original: dbang po legs par byas pa gang yin pa de dag ni sgra dag la so sor nges pa dag yin te /
analyzed: dbang po legs par byas pa gang yin pa de dag ni sgra dag la so sor nges pa dag yin te /
translated: the reply is that those sense faculties that have been properly functioning are distinct with regard to sounds.

original: legs par byas pa so sor nges pa de la 'ga' zhig gis dbang po legs par byas pas sgra 'ga' zhig 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir sgra thams cad cig car thos pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: legs par byas pa so sor nges pa de la 'ga' zhig gis dbang po legs par byas pas sgra 'ga' zhig 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir sgra thams cad cig car thos pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Some say: Since the ear sense faculty is well formed, it apprehends some sounds but not all sounds simultaneously.

original: de ltar legs par byas pa'i khyad par las rna ba'i dbang po rnams kyis thos pa yin par khas len pas na sgra'i tshogs sna tshogs pa'i ca co thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar legs par byas pa'i khyad par las rna ba'i dbang po rnams kyis thos pa yin par khas len pas na sgra'i tshogs sna tshogs pa'i ca co thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is accepted that sound is heard due to the specific formation of the ear sense faculty, then one would not hear the cacophony of a variety of sounds.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na ca co'i sgra gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na ca co'i sgra gcig kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be a single cacophonous sound.

original: ca co zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ca co zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states:

original: ca co zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: ca co zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig ma yin no //
translated: Cacophony is not a single sound.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gling bu dang rdza rnga la sogs pa dang snyan dngags dang / 'dod pa dang glu'i rang sgra rang bzhin tha dad pa can dag gis ca co cig car thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gling bu dang rdza rnga la sogs pa dang snyan dngags dang / 'dod pa dang glu'i rang sgra rang bzhin tha dad pa can dag gis ca co cig car thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one hears the cacophony of different sounds such as flutes, clay drums and so on, poetry, the natural sound of desire and song.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa can 'dzin pa la yang tha dad pa med pa ma yin te gang gi phyir tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang rang bzhin tha dad pa la brten pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste de 'dzin par nus pa'i dbang po ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na legs par byed cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa can 'dzin pa la yang tha dad pa med pa ma yin te gang gi phyir tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yang rang bzhin tha dad pa la brten pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // ci ste de 'dzin par nus pa'i dbang po ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na legs par byed cing /
translated: Also, in the apprehension of different natures, they are not undifferentiated, because the presentation of difference itself is dependent on different natures.üîΩBut if you assert that the sense faculty that is capable of apprehending sound is just that which is well formed,

original: dbang po legs par byas pa de ji ltar thag nye ba'i sgra 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po legs par byas pa de ji ltar thag nye ba'i sgra 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: and that well-formed sense faculty apprehends sound in accordance with its proximity,

original: rang @300b bzhin tha dad pa can gyi ca co yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: rang @300b bzhin tha dad pa can gyi ca co yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes 'dod de /
translated: then it would not apprehend the sound of a lute, which has a different nature.

original: gal te sgra thag nye ba'i dbang gis legs par byas pa yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te sgra thag nye ba'i dbang gis legs par byas pa yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: If sound is well formed due to its proximity,

original: rtag pa dang khyab par byed pa'i phyogs la sgra gang zhig gang la thag nye ba ma yin pa de ni cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab par byed pa'i phyogs la sgra gang zhig gang la thag nye ba ma yin pa de ni cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then in the case of permanent and pervasive phenomena, there is no sound that is not proximate. Therefore,

original: sgra thams cad cig car thos par 'gyur ba'i thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po nyi shu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: sgra thams cad cig car thos par 'gyur ba'i thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: The consequence would be that all sounds would be heard simultaneously.

original: gal te ca co'i sgra cig car 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te ca co'i sgra cig car 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the sound of a drum is not apprehended simultaneously,

original: 'on kyang go rims bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang go rims bzhin du yin te /
translated: but rather in sequence,

original: de la sgra du ma thos pa de dag kyang sgra'i 'jug pa myur ba yin pa de bas na 'jug pa myur ba'i rgyu'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'jug pa de dag gi go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa na yang cig car thos pa 'khrul pa yin no
analyzed: de la sgra du ma thos pa de dag kyang sgra'i 'jug pa myur ba yin pa de bas na 'jug pa myur ba'i rgyu'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'jug pa de dag gi go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa na yang cig car thos pa 'khrul pa yin no
translated: then even though many sounds are heard, because the engagement of the sound is swift, the engagement is swift due to its cause, and when it is apprehended in sequence, due to the sequence of engagement, the error of hearing it simultaneously arises.

original: zhe na / gal te de ltar 'jug pa myur ba las cig car thos par 'khrul pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhe na / gal te de ltar 'jug pa myur ba las cig car thos par 'khrul pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the error of hearing it simultaneously arises from the swift engagement, then at that time,

original: gling bu'i sgra ni rgyun go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gling bu'i sgra ni rgyun go bar byed pa ste /
translated: the sound of a flute is heard continuously.

original: skad kyi bye brag gang yin pa de dag gis go bar byed pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de dag la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyis 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: skad kyi bye brag gang yin pa de dag gis go bar byed pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de dag la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyis 'dus pa ste /
translated: The parts that are understood by the different tones are also assembled due to the swift engagement.

original: gcig tu byed pa'i phyir 'dres par rtogs par byed par 'gyur gyi go bar byed pa'i yan lag 'dres pa med pa'i go rims can gyis ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu byed pa'i phyir 'dres par rtogs par byed par 'gyur gyi go bar byed pa'i yan lag 'dres pa med pa'i go rims can gyis ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The order of the parts of the word is not confused, because the parts are combined into one.

original: de ltar na ring ba dang shin tu ring ba'i yan lag rnams la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyis cig car thos par 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ring po la sogs pas shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ring ba dang shin tu ring ba'i yan lag rnams la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyis cig car thos par 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ring po la sogs pas shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even in the case of distant and very distant parts, there is no confusion of hearing them all at once because of the speed of the engagement.

original: de bzhin du tshig dang ngag myur du brjod pa gzhan dag la yang snga phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig dang ngag myur du brjod pa gzhan dag la yang snga phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the case of other rapid speech and words, there is no confusion of understanding them in sequence.

original: 'di 'gog par byed pa yang le'u gsum pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug pa dpyod par byed pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'gog par byed pa yang le'u gsum pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car 'jug pa dpyod par byed pa las 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The refutation of this will be explained in the third chapter in the analysis of the simultaneous engagement of consciousness.

original: de bas na ca co la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyi sgo nas cig car thos pa 'khrul pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sgra mang po nyid cig car 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ca co la yang 'jug pa myur ba nyid kyi sgo nas cig car thos pa 'khrul pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sgra mang po nyid cig car 'dzin pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the case of rapid speech, there is no confusion of hearing them all at once because of the speed of the engagement, but rather it is the apprehension of many sounds all at once.

original: dbang po gcig nyid la so sor nges par 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra gcig rtogs shing khong du chud pa ni gcig rtogs pa yin la de ni nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ca co du ma'i bdag nyid can te sgra'i rang bzhin can thos pa ma
analyzed: dbang po gcig nyid la so sor nges par 'dod pa de'i tshe sgra gcig rtogs shing khong du chud pa ni gcig rtogs pa yin la de ni nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ca co du ma'i bdag nyid can te sgra'i rang bzhin can thos pa ma
translated: If you assert that a single sense faculty is definite in regard to each, then when one sound is cognized and comprehended, it is cognized as one, and because its potency is definite in regard to each, it is the nature of many sounds.

original: yin na thos par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin na thos par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not heard, it would be heard.

original: de bas na gcig rtogs par so sor nges pa med par de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na gcig rtogs par so sor nges pa med par de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, if it is not definite that one is cognized,üîΩthen the fault stated previously would still apply:

original: dbang po legs par byas pas gcig car thams cad @301a * //üîΩ'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i skyon de nyid gnas so //
analyzed: dbang po legs par byas pas gcig car thams cad @301a * // 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i skyon de nyid gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSince the sense faculty is well-formed, all are apprehended simultaneously.‚Äù

original: de la gal te sgra yan gar te ca co thos 'gyur rjod byed dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te sgra yan gar te ca co thos 'gyur rjod byed dag pa ma yin no //
translated: If one hears a mere sound, a cacophony, it is not a pure expression.

original: ca co la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ca co la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúIf one hears a cacophony‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: ca co la rjod par byed pa'i yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dag gi thos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ca co la rjod par byed pa'i yi ge dang tshig dang ngag dag gi thos pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not hear the syllables, words, and phrases that express a cacophony.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra tsam yan gar ba dag ste /
analyzed: sgra tsam yan gar ba dag ste /
translated: Because they are mere, isolated sounds.

original: rjod par byed pa ma yin pa de dag der thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ma yin pa de dag der thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who do not express are heard there.

original: gal te gcig rtogs par so sor nges pa la sgra tsam dag kyang ji ltar cig car thos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig rtogs par so sor nges pa la sgra tsam dag kyang ji ltar cig car thos pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is ascertained that one is understood, then how is it that mere sounds are heard simultaneously?

original: rjod par byed pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is the expressive sound . . . ‚Äù

original: rjod par byed pa'i sgra la dbang po so sor nges pa'i nus pa can la kho bo cag brjod kyi sgra tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i sgra la dbang po so sor nges pa'i nus pa can la kho bo cag brjod kyi sgra tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: We assert that the expressive sound has the capacity to ascertain the individual faculties, but not that mere sound is expressive.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He responds to that with ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra tsam khyad par kho na rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra tsam khyad par kho na rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Mere sound is only expressive of a specific attribute.

original: sgra tsam de dag las tha dad de don gzhan du 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa sgra'i ngo bo yod de zhes bya ba de ni yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra tsam de dag las tha dad de don gzhan du 'gyur ba rjod par byed pa sgra'i ngo bo yod de zhes bya ba de ni yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is a different entity from mere sound, an expressive sound that is a different object, does not exist. The statement ‚ÄúThe entity of sound that is expressive exists‚Äù is not established because there is no valid knowledge that establishes its existence.

original: 'di la shin tu che sa dad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la shin tu che sa dad par bya'o //
translated: One should have great faith in this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis sgra tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / sgra rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa zhes bya ba sgra tsam las rang bzhin la tha dad par 'gyur ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis sgra tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / sgra rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa zhes bya ba sgra tsam las rang bzhin la tha dad par 'gyur ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: Because we do not see that mere sound is different from sound, or that the nature of sound that expresses is different from sound.

original: 'on kyang dus gcig gi tshe ste skad cig ma gcig la yi ge'i go rims thos pa na sgra'i bdag nyid de yi ge'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid kho nar nges so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dus gcig gi tshe ste skad cig ma gcig la yi ge'i go rims thos pa na sgra'i bdag nyid de yi ge'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid kho nar nges so //
translated: But at one time, at one moment, when the order of letters is heard, that which has the nature of sound is ascertained just by the characteristic of the order of letters.

original: sgra tsam zhes bya ba'am sgra zhes bya ba bstan pa 'di dngos po tha dad pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgra tsam zhes bya ba'am sgra zhes bya ba bstan pa 'di dngos po tha dad pa yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the teaching of mere sound or sound does not exist as a different entity.

original: de bas na nges pa sngon du song ba can te /
analyzed: de bas na nges pa sngon du song ba can te /
translated: Therefore, it is preceded by ascertainment.

original: zhen pa sngon du song ba can sgra tsam las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yongs su bcad cing nges par 'gyur ba med par sgra tsam tha dad pa'i ngo bo yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rgyu med pa can la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhen pa sngon du song ba can sgra tsam las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yongs su bcad cing nges par 'gyur ba med par sgra tsam tha dad pa'i ngo bo yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad rgyu med pa can la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How could one engage in the expression ‚Äúthe mere sound exists as a different entity‚Äù without a cause, which is a complete ascertainment and determination of the nature of the mere sound that is the opposite of the one who has previously clung to it?

original: de bas na sgra tsam gyi khyad par nyid yi ge aa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i go rims kyi khyad par gyis gnas pa ni yi ge la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na sgra tsam gyi khyad par nyid yi ge aa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i go rims kyi khyad par gyis gnas pa ni yi ge la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: yi ge dang pos byas pas gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni tshig dang ngag la sogs pa gzung ngo // gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes words, speech, and so on.

analyzed: gal te sgra tsam dag las gzhan pa'i rjod par byed @301b pa de'i ca co yang thos pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the sound of speech is not different from the sound of mere speech, then the sound of speech would be heard even when there is no speaker.üîΩIf the sound of speech is different from the sound of mere speech, then the sound of speech would be heard even when there is no speaker.
