analyzed: der sgra tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dag thos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de rjod par byed do //
translated: because one hears mere sound that is not expressive.

original: ca co de la gang gi tshe mang po dag kha rog par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ca co de la gang gi tshe mang po dag kha rog par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is a great deal of babbling, because many people are speaking.

original: sgra gzhan dag ni gnas pa na skyes bu gcig smra bar byed pa gcig po de'i sgra rjod byed ci ltar thos pa yin te de ni de'i tshe nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra gzhan dag ni gnas pa na skyes bu gcig smra bar byed pa gcig po de'i sgra rjod byed ci ltar thos pa yin te de ni de'i tshe nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When other sounds are present, one hears the sound of the one person who is speaking, because one focuses on that sound.

original: rjod par byed pa 'di las sgra tsam tha dad pa'i ngo bo rjod par byed pa de dang lhan cig gam tha dad par ni thos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa 'di las sgra tsam tha dad pa'i ngo bo rjod par byed pa de dang lhan cig gam tha dad par ni thos pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not hear mere sound that is separate from the expressive sound, whether it is simultaneous with it or not.

original: gal te rjod par byed pa las sgra tsam gzhan yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rjod par byed pa las sgra tsam gzhan yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If mere sound were different from the expressive sound,

original: de yang de'i tshe thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be heard at that time.

original: gcig brjod pa na sgra tsam nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te mang po dag smra ba la yang de med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig brjod pa na sgra tsam nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te mang po dag smra ba la yang de med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One cannot say that mere sound does not exist when one sound is uttered, because it would follow that it does not exist when many sounds are uttered.

original: de bas na ji ltar gcig smra bar byed pa na sgra tha dad pa med par thos pa de dag mngan po dag la yin no de bas na rjod par byed pa'i sgra las sgra tsam gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar gcig smra bar byed pa na sgra tha dad pa med par thos pa de dag mngan po dag la yin no de bas na rjod par byed pa'i sgra las sgra tsam gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one speaks, the mere sound is not different from the sound that is the expression, just as the sound that is heard by the ears is not different from the sound that is the object of the ears.

original: gal te gcig smra bar byed pa na yang rjod par byed pa las tha dad par sgra tsam nges par gzung ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig smra bar byed pa na yang rjod par byed pa las tha dad par sgra tsam nges par gzung ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that when one speaks, the mere sound is apprehended as different from the expression,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyi don la gzhan gyis bstan pa chen por 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyi don la gzhan gyis bstan pa chen por 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: Because when the object is directly perceived, it is not taught by another.

original: gang gis bdag nyid kyis tha dad pa thos pa med par yang khyod kyi tshig tsam tha dad par thos pa de ltar mang po dag la yang rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis bdag nyid kyis tha dad pa thos pa med par yang khyod kyi tshig tsam tha dad par thos pa de ltar mang po dag la yang rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: When one hears the mere sound that is different from the expression, one understands that it is the same for many people, even though one does not hear the difference for oneself.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir nyan pa po 'dis smra ba po gzhan dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba na sgra 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir nyan pa po 'dis smra ba po gzhan dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba na sgra 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Therefore, for that reason, when this listener tames other speakers, it is only sound.

original: gcig nyid smra bar byed pa na sgra tsam tha dad pa'i don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid thos pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen byed pa yon tan la sogs pa sgra dmigs pa'i rkyen dag nus pa med pa nges par byed de /
analyzed: gcig nyid smra bar byed pa na sgra tsam tha dad pa'i don gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid thos pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen byed pa yon tan la sogs pa sgra dmigs pa'i rkyen dag nus pa med pa nges par byed de /
translated: When one speaks of a single sound, the sound itself is the object of hearing that is different from the other sound. The objective conditions of the sound, such as the qualities, are ascertained to be ineffective.

original: ci zhig byed pa la zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed pa la zhe na /
translated: What does it do?

original: de las gzhan pa sgrub pa la ste sgra gcig thos pa las gzhan sgra tsam grub pa la'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa sgrub pa la ste sgra gcig thos pa las gzhan sgra tsam grub pa la'o //
translated: It establishes the other, that is, it establishes the sound itself, which is different from the sound that is heard.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gal te dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis de dag gis de dag las gzhan pa sgrub pa nus pa dag tu 'gyur na de'i tshe de sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis de dag gis de dag las gzhan pa sgrub pa nus pa dag tu 'gyur na de'i tshe de sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the objective conditions were capable of establishing the other, then at the time of establishing that,

original: sgra dmigs pa'i rkyen des sgrub pa sgra las tha dad pa'i sgra tsam gyi ngo bo de dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dmigs pa'i rkyen des sgrub pa sgra las tha dad pa'i sgra tsam gyi ngo bo de dmigs par 'gyur na dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the sound that is the objective condition would be observed as the nature of the sound itself, which is different from the sound. But it is not observed.

original: ji ltar smra ba po gcig gis sgra'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis sgra tsam tha dad pa sgrub pa la nus pa med pa de ltar @302a * //üîΩmang po dag la yang ngo //üîΩde bas na sgra smra ba po dag gis rjod par byed pa dag las ca co'i sgra tsam tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba po gcig gis sgra'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis sgra tsam tha dad pa sgrub pa la nus pa med pa de ltar @302a * // mang po dag la yang ngo // de bas na sgra smra ba po dag gis rjod par byed pa dag las ca co'i sgra tsam tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as one speaker does not have the power to establish a mere sound that is different due to the objective conditions of sound, so it is with many.

original: de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that a mere sound that is different from the sounds that are expressed by speakers does not exist, he says, ‚ÄúThe mere sound that is of the same nature as those sounds . . .‚Äù

original: sgra tsam dang bral ba sgra gcig skyed pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi sgra'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis mang po dag smras pa dag la yang /
analyzed: sgra tsam dang bral ba sgra gcig skyed pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi sgra'i dmigs pa'i rkyen dag gis mang po dag smras pa dag la yang /
translated: The objective conditions of sound, which are the mere sound that is of the same nature as those sounds that are expressed by many speakers, do not produce a mere sound that is different from the sound that is their own effect.

original: ci ltar sgra'i bdag nyid rang gi 'bras bu gcig pu ma gtogs pa ca co'i sgra tsam 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa rtsom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar sgra'i bdag nyid rang gi 'bras bu gcig pu ma gtogs pa ca co'i sgra tsam 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa rtsom par 'gyur te /
translated: How could they produce a mere sound that is different from the sound that is their own effect, such as the sound of a donkey?

original: rtsom pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsom pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not produce it.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: Because there is no difference in their cause,

original: rgyu'i ngo bo gcig nyid la 'bras bu tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo gcig nyid la 'bras bu tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is not logical that a single nature of the cause is different from the effect.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi tshe med pa dang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis 'ga' zhig gi tshe med pa dang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the cause itself is sometimes nonexistent and sometimes existent, as is said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa la ltos pa med pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa med pa de ni rgyu med pa can nyid thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Because it would follow that the effect would be without a cause, since it would not depend on a different cause. This has already been explained.

original: ca co'i sgra tsam thos par 'gyur ba yin gyi /üîΩrjod par byed pa'i sgra dag ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: ca co'i sgra tsam thos par 'gyur ba yin gyi / rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin pa de lta na /

original: ca co la rjod par byed pa ma thos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ca co la rjod par byed pa ma thos pa ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang thos pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thos pa kho na yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: ca co smra ba'i tshig dag la tshig dang ngag rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands the words and speech in the words of babbling.

original: gzhan yang dbang po gcig rtogs pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po gcig rtogs pa //

analyzed: rjod par byed pa tha dad pa'i rang bzhin dag kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod /

original: gal te 'di ltar lhan cig byed pa thag nye ba na phyis rang gi shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba gang yin pa dang 'bad rtsol las sngar nye bar sbyor ba ma yin pa'i gnas skabs de dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin na /

analyzed: gnas skabs de dag gi khyad par te bye brag ni rang bzhin las bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gal te tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i tshe phul du byung ba de nyid la sgra'i shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba grub pa ste rgyu nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad par 'gyur ba de'i tshe phul du byung ba de nyid la sgra'i shes pa la nye bar sbyor ba grub pa ste rgyu nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'pho ba med pa can gyi sgra'i ngo bo de ni rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na gang kho na yod na bsgrub byar grub pa de nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba de la nye bar sbyor ba can du rigs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir na phul du byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: phul du byung ba don gzhan du gyur pa brtag par bya dgos pa de lta na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //

original: de bas na de las gzhan pa ste rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: de bas na de las gzhan pa ste rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis khyad par du byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished by the distinctive feature of the nature of a word that is different from that, which does not produce cognition of its own object.

original: gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis zhe na /

analyzed: nus pa bar du mchod pas nye bar sbyor ba gnas skabs tha dad pa gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo skyed par byed pa'i gnas skabs las gzhan skyed par mi byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: a distinctive feature of a state that does not produce what is different from the state that produces the nature of a word.

analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bad rtsol las sngar yang rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir skyed par mi byed do zhe na /

analyzed: phul du dbyung du med pa can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: gang las 'bras bu thams cad dang chos mtshungs pa yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro // 'bras bu thams cad dang chos mtshungs pa can gyi sgra de 'dra ba de gsal ba yin par 'dod na /

analyzed: gzhan du na'ang ste /

analyzed: gsal byed las rnyed pa'i shes pa'i rgyu phul du byung ba de ni sngar grub pa'i phyir grab pa zhes mi bya'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i phul du byung ba de nyid na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i phul du byung ba de nyid na /

analyzed: gang gsal byed kyi tshogs pa'i rkyen de rgyu yod pa de ni zhes bya bar tshig rnam @309a * //

analyzed: par sbyar ro //

analyzed: sgra'i dmigs pa'i rgyu dag kyang rdza mkhan la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro ;

analyzed: / sgra yang bum pa la sogs pa gzhan du 'bras bu nyid yin no //

analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin na ni du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi don la sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa de sbyor ba la sngar yod pa yin te /

original: de'i phyir ngo shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: yod pa rnam par gnas pa'i phyir te ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba ni ma yin no //

translated: Thus, the application of the axe, etc., is a second reason whose meaning is not established in the other case, i.e., in the case of the thesis that sound is impermanent.

analyzed: rtags gang cung zad sgra gcig nyid du grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa phyis te /

analyzed: de ni re zhig sgrib par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo la byed pa rnams kyi nus pa med pa gang yin pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa grub pa'i ngo bo byed pa cung zad kyang mi byed par nus pa med pa dag ni sgrib par byed pa
translated: That which does not have the ability to obscure even slightly that which is already established does not obscure.

original: dag dang bral ba yin du zin kyang nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dag dang bral ba yin du zin kyang nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is free from that which is obscured, it does not have the ability to obscure.

original: gang gi phyir bral ba yang med pa yin la med pa yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes sngar spyi gsal bar dpyod pa'i skabs su brjod zin to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bral ba yang med pa yin la med pa yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes sngar spyi gsal bar dpyod pa'i skabs su brjod zin to zhes bstan to //
translated: Because that which is free does not exist and that which does not exist is not an effect, this was previously explained in the context of the analysis of the manifestation of universals.

original: sgrib par byed pa khas blangs nas de skad du bshad nas de nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa khas blangs nas de skad du bshad nas de nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having accepted the obscurer and explained it in that way, in order to demonstrate that it does not exist in reality, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, Sound and so on are not permanent, and so on.

original: sgra rtag pa ma byas pa phul du byung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra rtag pa ma byas pa phul du byung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa yin na /
translated: If sound were permanent, unproduced, and not supreme, then it would be slightly obscured.

original: gang gis sgrib par byed pa dang bral ba gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis sgrib par byed pa dang bral ba gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be illuminated when it is free from that which obscures it?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrib par byed pa de ni dngos po rtag pa nyid la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa de ni dngos po rtag pa nyid la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that that which obscures it is not capable of a permanent entity.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sgrib par byed pa la byed pa dag nye bar dgod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sgrib par byed pa la byed pa dag nye bar dgod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Since that is the case, the activity of that which obscures should not be posited.

original: byed pa dag gis sgra sgrib par byed par byed pa dang bral bar byed do zhes bya ba de ltar nye bar dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i byed pa de dag kyang sgra la nus pa med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dag gis sgra sgrib par byed par byed pa dang bral bar byed do zhes bya ba de ltar nye bar dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i byed pa de dag kyang sgra la nus pa med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The activity of that which obscures should not be posited in this way: ‚ÄúThe activity of that which obscures makes sound free from that which obscures it.‚Äù Those activities also do not make sound incapable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba med pa ste /
translated: Because their activity does not exist.

original: byed pa dag gi bya ba med par sgra mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa dag gi bya ba med par sgra mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is not observed when the activity of that which obscures it does not exist.

original: de bas na byed pa'i bya ba de dag gis sgra byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa'i bya ba de dag gis sgra byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, sound is made by the activity of that which obscures it.

original: de ltar ma yin na ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ste /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te byed pa po ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If the agent is not the cause,

original: 'on kyang gsal ba byed pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba byed pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: but rather the manifestor,

original: sgra dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa dag gis bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rdza mkhan la sogs pa dag gis bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because there would be no difference between the manifestor and the sound, such things as the potter would manifest such things as the pot.

original: ji ste rdza mkhan la sogs pas bum pa la sogs pa de dag gsal ba nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste rdza mkhan la sogs pas bum pa la sogs pa de dag gsal ba nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you maintain that such things as the potter manifest such things as the pot,

original: de bzhin du ni khas len na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ni khas len na /
translated: then we accept that.

original: rgyu rnams kun ni don med nyid 'gyur te bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kun ni don med nyid 'gyur te bya ba 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All causes would be pointless, because there would be no activity.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang 'chad par byed de /
translated: He also explains by means of the following:

original: gal te @313a * //üîΩrgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi byed pa sgra gsal bar byed pa dag gis kyang ste /
analyzed: gal te @313a * // rgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi byed pa sgra gsal bar byed pa dag gis kyang ste /
translated: If the manifestorüîΩis the cause,üîΩthen all causes would be pointless, because there would be no activity.

original: byed pa gang dag la rgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa nyid yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed pa gang dag la rgyu thams cad dang chos mthun pa nyid yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: If the manifestor is the cause, then all causes would be pointless, because there would be no activity.

original: de'i tshe da ni 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe da ni 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bur mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, nothing would be the effect of anything,

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything, such as a pot, would be manifest.

original: gal te med pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir thams cad gsal bye nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir thams cad gsal bye nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that everything is manifest because there is no arising of the nonexistent,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde zhes bya ba ni thams cad mngon par gsal bar rtogs pa'o / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de zhes bya ba ni thams cad mngon par gsal bar rtogs pa'o / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: rgyu thams cad gsal bar byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dag don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu thams cad gsal bar byed pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa dag don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is illogical because it is accepted that all causes are manifest, and it follows that they would be pointless.

original: de ltar gsal bar byed pa dag ni dngos po gsal bar bya ba phul du byung ba dang / sgrib par byed pa med pa dang / shes par byed pa'i phyir gsal byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gsum du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar gsal bar byed pa dag ni dngos po gsal bar bya ba phul du byung ba dang / sgrib par byed pa med pa dang / shes par byed pa'i phyir gsal byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa gsum du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If they are manifest, then there are three ideas: they are manifest because they make a thing that is to be manifest superior, they are manifest because there is no obstruction, and they are manifest because they make something known.

original: re zhig gsal bu phul du byung ba byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gsal bu phul du byung ba byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of making the effect manifest, because it is not manifest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas pa'i ngo bo can gyi dngos bo ni bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgrib par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i ngo bo can gyi dngos bo ni bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // sgrib par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: Because the nature of an enduring entity is to be distinguished as non-action.

original: sgrib par byed pa de ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa de ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it for the sake of removing obstruction, because that obstruction is not the effect.

original: rnam par shes pa byed pa'i phyir yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa byed pa'i phyir yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it for the sake of making the effect manifest, because consciousness is not the agent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang dngos po dang 'dra bar 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i gzhung las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yang dngos po dang 'dra bar 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i gzhung las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the entity, the consciousness that has it as its object is established by the proponents of the effect theory.

original: ji ste shes pa la 'ga' zhig gi byed pa po nyid du 'dod na de la khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa dang 'dra bar bum pa la sogs pa yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams byed pa po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste shes pa la 'ga' zhig gi byed pa po nyid du 'dod na de la khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa dang 'dra bar bum pa la sogs pa yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams byed pa po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that consciousness is the agent of something, then, because it is not distinguished from that, like consciousness, a pot and so on would be the agent of the potter and so on.

original: gsal bya'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na don gyi tshogs bum pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gsal bya'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pa de bas na don gyi tshogs bum pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: That is just so, etc.

original: gzhan byed pa por 'dod pa 'di bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan byed pa por 'dod pa 'di bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: This assertion that something else is the agent does not apply to any manifest entities such as a pot,

original: dngos po ni bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par can nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu gsal ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par can nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu gsal ba bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the refutation of manifest entities is clearly stated immediately after the statement, ‚ÄúAn entity is not qualified by an action.‚Äù

original: med pa'i bya ba la yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i bya ba la yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it apply to a nonexistent action,

original: 'ga' zhig kyang 'bras bu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang 'bras bu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be meaningless, since no one accepts that it is an effect.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba byed pa po rnams 'bras bu med pa can yin na 'gro ba 'di byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba byed pa po rnams 'bras bu med pa can yin na 'gro ba 'di byed pa med pa ste /
translated: Thus, if agents do not have effects, this world would be without agents,

original: bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: that is, without action.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What would be the case?

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: It would be without those who benefit and those who are benefited.

original: gang la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be benefited and that which benefits‚Äù is a compound.

original: gzhan yang sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la yang ngo shes pa dang yod sbyor stsogs /üîΩgang yin sgrub byed 'dod na ni ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la yang ngo shes pa dang yod sbyor stsogs / gang yin sgrub byed 'dod na ni ste /
translated: Moreover, in the proof that sound is permanent, the reason is accepted as being a property of the subject.

original: khas len na dper na sgra rtag ste ngo shes par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir dang yod par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len na dper na sgra rtag ste ngo shes par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir dang yod par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one accepts that, then, for example, sound is permanent because it is recognized and because it is connected with existence.

original: gang rab tu sbyor bar byed pa de ni sngar yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rab tu sbyor bar byed pa de ni sngar yod pa yin te /
translated: That which is connected is something that exists previously,

original: dper na ste'u la sogs pa'i gcod pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ste'u la sogs pa'i gcod pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: like the ax, etc., in the act of cutting.

original: don ston pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa de bas na de yang sbyor ba las sdar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: don ston pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar byed pa de bas na de yang sbyor ba las sdar yod pa yin no //
translated: Sound is connected in order to indicate the meaning, and therefore it exists previously, because of the connection.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni phyis yi ge aa rtogs pa ni snga ma dang tha dad pa med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni phyis yi ge aa rtogs pa ni snga ma dang tha dad pa med pa'i yul can yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the proof that the later cognition of the letter ‚Äúa‚Äù is a subject that is not different from the former.

original: dpe med pa can yin te /
analyzed: dpe med pa can yin te /
translated: It is without example.

original: gang rtag pa 'ga' zhig la sgrub par byed pa de gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas na dpe med pa can yin no //
analyzed: gang rtag pa 'ga' zhig la sgrub par byed pa de gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas na dpe med pa can yin no //
translated: Since there is no establishment of anything permanent, it is without example.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos kun ni skad cig gis ni 'jig phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos kun ni skad cig gis ni 'jig phyir ro //
translated: Because all things are momentary.

original: re zhig tshig de nyid rnam par 'grel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig tshig de nyid rnam par 'grel pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain just that statement, he says,

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll things‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes sngar bshad pa dang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes sngar bshad pa dang phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for destruction, as was explained earlier and will be explained later.

original: 'jig pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa nyid du bstan nas skye ba'i sgo nas kyang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa nyid du bstan nas skye ba'i sgo nas kyang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having taught impermanence in terms of destruction, in order to teach it in terms of arising, he says, ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan las te rgyu gzhan las dngos po thams cad skye ba can yang yin pa de bas na mi rtag pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las te rgyu gzhan las dngos po thams cad skye ba can yang yin pa de bas na mi rtag pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: and from another, i.e., from a cause other than itself, all things are born, therefore they are impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzhan las skye ba yin gyi ci'i phyir glo bur ba nyid @314a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzhan las skye ba yin gyi ci'i phyir glo bur ba nyid @314a * //
translated: Why?

original: du 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Because they are born from another. Why is it not the case that they are adventitious?

original: yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of the thing itself,‚Äù etc.

original: glo bur ba nyid la yul dang dus dang rdzas des pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur ba nyid la yul dang dus dang rdzas des pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because adventitiousness is not possible in regard to place, time, and substance.

original: de nyid sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained earlier.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, for that reason.

original: ngo shes pa dang yod par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rtags ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo gcig pa can 'ga' zhig la yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo shes pa dang yod par sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rtags ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo gcig pa can 'ga' zhig la yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason, i.e., the recognition, the application of the existence, etc., does not apply to any single nature of a thing that is a homogeneous case.

original: rgyun la brten pa nyid du brtag ba'i phyir yang gcig smos pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyun la brten pa nyid du brtag ba'i phyir yang gcig smos pa yin la /
translated: The single mention is for the purpose of designating the dependence on the continuum.

original: skad cig ma gcig la yang ngo bo gcig pa nyid yod pa'i phyir brtan pa smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la yang ngo bo gcig pa nyid yod pa'i phyir brtan pa smos te /
translated: Since there is a single nature in a single moment, ‚Äústability‚Äù is mentioned.

original: dus thams cad du 'jig pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'jig pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is that it is not subject to destruction at all times.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa gang dag la rang bzhin gzhan dag gzhan du ste /
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa gang dag la rang bzhin gzhan dag gzhan du ste /
translated: In regard to lamps, etc., where other natures are different,

original: phan tshun gyur pa'i skye ba yod pa de dag nyid la ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pas na 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gyur pa'i skye ba yod pa de dag nyid la ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pas na 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: i.e., mutually transformed, since the evidence of recognition, etc. is seen, it exists in the discordant side, and so there is contradiction.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi yin te ngo shes pa 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi yin te ngo shes pa 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and so on means that for others, recognition is not contradictory.

original: ngo shes pa gang la skye ba tha dad pa med pa bstan pa ngo bo gcig pa can yod pa ste /
analyzed: ngo shes pa gang la skye ba tha dad pa med pa bstan pa ngo bo gcig pa can yod pa ste /
translated: Recognition is where there is no difference in arising, i.e., where there is a single nature.

original: 'khrul pa sgron ma la sogs pa dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa sgron ma la sogs pa dag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It exists in lamps, etc., which are mistaken.

original: gal te 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how it is mistaken,

original: chos mthun pa nyid can du rnam par 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid can du rnam par 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
translated: because of the error of similarity.

original: skad cig ma snga phyi dag gis 'dra ba gang yin pa des rnam par 'khrul pa ste bslus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma snga phyi dag gis 'dra ba gang yin pa des rnam par 'khrul pa ste bslus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is similar through the former and latter moments is the error, i.e., the deception.

original: de skad du ngo shes pa 'khrul pa med pa gtan tshigs nyid du gzung ba de yang sgron ma la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de skad du ngo shes pa 'khrul pa med pa gtan tshigs nyid du gzung ba de yang sgron ma la sogs pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Thus, he says that the very non-erroneous recognition is not accepted as the proof.

original: skye ba tha dad pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyi yin te /
analyzed: skye ba tha dad pa med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyi yin te /
translated: The master [ƒÄryadeva] says, ‚ÄúThere is no difference in arising,‚Äù etc.

original: gang la brten nas te tshad ma gang gis skye ba tha dad pa med pa can ngo shes pa zhes brjod pa yin /
analyzed: gang la brten nas te tshad ma gang gis skye ba tha dad pa med pa can ngo shes pa zhes brjod pa yin /
translated: By what means, i.e., by what valid cognition, is the non-difference in arising called recognition?

original: brtan pa ngo bo gcig pa can las ngo shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa ngo bo gcig pa can las ngo shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest valid cognition that says recognition arises from a single entity that is stable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad pa med pa de ni rdo rje la sogs pa thams cad la yang snga phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa de ni rdo rje la sogs pa thams cad la yang snga phyir te /
translated: Because that non-difference is in all things, such as a vajra, earlier and later.

original: dper na rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa phyis kyang de nyid yin nam /
analyzed: dper na rdo rje la sogs pa'i sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa phyis kyang de nyid yin nam /
translated: For example, is the former intrinsic reality of a vajra and so on also its later intrinsic reality?

original: 'on te gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nyid yin /
translated: For example, is the former intrinsic reality of a diamond and so on the same as the latter or is it different?üîΩOr is it the same as a lamp and so on, but confused as one due to aggregation?

original: 'on kyang sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'du ba las gcig nyid du 'khrul pa yin no zhes dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'du ba las gcig nyid du 'khrul pa yin no zhes dpyad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This should be investigated.

original: gal te ji ltar rdo rje la sogs pa'i tha dad pa med pa de bzhin @314b du de dag gi tha dad pa yang nges pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar rdo rje la sogs pa'i tha dad pa med pa de bzhin @314b du de dag gi tha dad pa yang nges pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the difference of those is not ascertained, just as the nondifference of a diamond and so on is,

original: ma yin te grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa tha dad pa la sogs pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te grang ba dang dro ba'i reg pa tha dad pa la sogs pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not so, because the difference of cold and warm touch and so on is ascertained.

original: de ltar ni rdo rje la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu grang bar 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig gi dro bar 'gyur ba de yang tha dad pa med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni rdo rje la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu grang bar 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig gi dro bar 'gyur ba de yang tha dad pa med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, a diamond and so on is sometimes cold and sometimes warm, but it is not tenable that it is not different.

original: khas blangs nas kyang nges pa yod pa ma yin par brjod pa ni de nyid kyi the tshom yin pa yang bla ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang nges pa yod pa ma yin par brjod pa ni de nyid kyi the tshom yin pa yang bla ste /
translated: It is obvious that there is doubt about that.

original: gcig tu tha dad pa med pa nyid yin no zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang shes pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs tha dad pa med pa'i go rims rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu tha dad pa med pa nyid yin no zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang shes pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs tha dad pa med pa'i go rims rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if one does not understand that there is no difference at all, it is not logical to say that the reason ‚Äúbecause of consciousness‚Äù is not different.

original: de nyid ni the tshom zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba'i ngo shes pa'i rtags las sgra dag gcig nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni the tshom zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba'i ngo shes pa'i rtags las sgra dag gcig nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: He shows just that in ‚ÄúDoubt, etc.‚Äù One does not establish that sounds are the same by a reason that is doubtful with regard to the similar class.

original: gal te gnas skabs snga phyi dag tha dad pa ste so sor mthong ba med pa'i phyir rdo rje sogs pa dag gcig nyid du grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs snga phyi dag tha dad pa ste so sor mthong ba med pa'i phyir rdo rje sogs pa dag gcig nyid du grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says that a vajra, etc., is established as the same because the earlier and later states are not seen to be different, that is, are not seen separately,

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
translated: he refutes that with ‚ÄúNo, etc.‚Äù

original: rdo rje la sogs pa dag la tha dad par mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa dag la tha dad par mthong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no seeing of a difference in a vajra, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa snga phyis rdo rje la sogs pa'i shes pa dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ba can nyid kyi yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa snga phyis rdo rje la sogs pa'i shes pa dag go rims bzhin du 'byung ba can nyid kyi yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the prior and subsequent consciousnesses of the vajra, etc., are established as existent and nonexistent, respectively.

original: de ltar na rdo rje la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyis kyi shes pa sngar med pas rang gi rgyu'i khyad par sngar med pa nyid sgrub par byed cing phyis yod pas kyang yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ltar na shes pa snga ma dang phyi
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rje la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyis kyi shes pa sngar med pas rang gi rgyu'i khyad par sngar med pa nyid sgrub par byed cing phyis yod pas kyang yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba de ltar na shes pa snga ma dang phyi
translated: Thus, the subsequent consciousness that observes the vajra, etc., establishes the prior nonexistence of its own cause, and the subsequent existence of its own cause, and thus the prior and subsequent consciousnesses

original: mas rdo rje la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mas rdo rje la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: establish the vajra, etc., as existent and nonexistent, respectively.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir te tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa srid pa'i phyir te tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they have different natures, i.e., because they exist as different.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that point, he says, ‚ÄúIf the subsequent consciousness,‚Äù etc.

original: phyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa sngar te /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba dus phyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi shes pa sngar te /
translated: The subsequent consciousness is the consciousness that arises later, i.e., that has the nature of arising later.

original: shes pa snga ma'i dus na rgyu thag nye ba can dag yin na shes pa snga ma dang 'dra bar skye ba nyid du 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa snga ma'i dus na rgyu thag nye ba can dag yin na shes pa snga ma dang 'dra bar skye ba nyid du 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If they were the proximate cause at the time of the prior cognition, they would arise in the same way as the prior cognition, but that is not the case.

original: de bas na shes pa de dag mi skye na ni sngar rang gi rgyu dang bral ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa de dag mi skye na ni sngar rang gi rgyu dang bral ba ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, if those cognitions do not arise, it demonstrates that they are previously devoid of their cause.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gal te rgyu de dag sngar yod par 'gyur ba yin na yang nus pa'am nus pa med par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gal te rgyu de dag sngar yod par 'gyur ba yin na yang nus pa'am nus pa med par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Otherwise, if those causes existed previously, they would either be potent or not potent.

original: gal te nus na ni sngar yang skye par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nus na ni sngar yang skye par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are potent, they would arise previously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nus pa ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because potency is what generates.

original: ci ste nus pa med na yang phyis kyang skyed par mi 'gyur @315a * //
analyzed: ci ste nus pa med na yang phyis kyang skyed par mi 'gyur @315a * //
translated: But if they are not potent, they will not generate later.

original: ro ; / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ro ; / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: nus pa med pa ni phul du byung ba nyid du byar med pa nyid kyis gang las kyang nus pa rnyed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa med pa ni phul du byung ba nyid du byar med pa nyid kyis gang las kyang nus pa rnyed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is not potent cannot be made potent, and therefore it will not obtain potency from anything.

original: ci ste phyis 'ga' zhig las nus pa rnyed pa de'i tshe nus pa rnyed pa nyid yin na ni brtag pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci ste phyis 'ga' zhig las nus pa rnyed pa de'i tshe nus pa rnyed pa nyid yin na ni brtag pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: But if it is the acquisition of potency at a later time, then that is not tenable, because

original: sngar gyi nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyams nas nus pa gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyams nas nus pa gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the prior nature that lacks potency is destroyed and another potency is generated.

original: de bas na go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yul gyi shes pa dag gis rang gi yul gyi go rims kyang sgrub par byed pa de ltar na dngos po thams cad tha dad par grub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yul gyi shes pa dag gis rang gi yul gyi go rims kyang sgrub par byed pa de ltar na dngos po thams cad tha dad par grub pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognitions of objects that occur in sequence establish the sequence of their objects. Thus, since all things are established as distinct, they are impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na yod pa'i sbyor pa 'di yin pa de lta na yang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na yod pa'i sbyor pa 'di yin pa de lta na yang ste /
translated: Since that is so, even though this is the application of existence,

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa brjod pa gang yin pa des kyang sbyor ba po'i nus pas sgra la sogs pa skyed pa gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa brjod pa gang yin pa des kyang sbyor ba po'i nus pas sgra la sogs pa skyed pa gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: the second reason that is stated also expresses the potency of the agent of application, which is the production of sound and so on.

original: rgyu'i nus pa las yod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa 'dis yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa las yod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa 'dis yin gyi /
translated: This is explained by the expression ‚Äúthe application of that which exists by the power of the cause.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba po'i bya ba las sngar yod cing snang ba'i rang gi 'bras bu'i bya ba la sbyor ba las bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba po'i bya ba las sngar yod cing snang ba'i rang gi 'bras bu'i bya ba la sbyor ba las bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the activity of the effect that exists prior to the activity of the agent is applied to the activity of the agent.

original: de lta ma yin na sbyor ba po'i bya ba las sdar ste'u la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sbyor ba po'i bya ba las sdar ste'u la sogs pa'am /
translated: If that were not so, then prior to the activity of the agent, the activity of the effect would exist,

original: sgra rang gi 'bras bul nus pa yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sgra rang gi 'bras bul nus pa yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: and at the time that the power of the effect exists in the sound,

original: bdag nyid kyi nus pa la sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nus pa la sbyor ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the application of the power of the effect would not exist.

original: de ltar na skyes bu la ltos pa med par ste'u la sogs pa bdag nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu la ltos pa med par ste'u la sogs pa bdag nyid 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the activity of the effect would occur without depending on the agent.

original: gal te sbyor ba'i sgras skye ba nyid brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba'i sgras skye ba nyid brjod pa yin na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúapplication‚Äù expresses arising,

original: ci'i phyir ste'u la sogs pa dang sgra'i skye ba zhes mi brjod par ci'i phyir sbyor ba smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ste'u la sogs pa dang sgra'i skye ba zhes mi brjod par ci'i phyir sbyor ba smos she na /
translated: why is it not said that the arising of the sound is the arising of the axe, etc.? Why is ‚Äúapplication‚Äù mentioned?

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúApplication‚Äù is said to be the activity of the cause.

original: 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don gcod pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa grub pa de la ste'u la sogs pa nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don gcod pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa grub pa de la ste'u la sogs pa nus pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: The axe, etc., which are the cause of the accomplishment of the desired object, i.e., the cutting, etc., are said to be the producers of the nature of efficacy.

original: nus pa nyid ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: nus pa nyid ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of efficacy?

original: rigs mthun pa ste nye bar len pa 'dra ba rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig ma la ltos pa can zhes bya ba rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa la ltos pa can no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa ste nye bar len pa 'dra ba rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig ma la ltos pa can zhes bya ba rigs mthun pa'i nye bar len pa la ltos pa can no //
translated: It is the dependence on a homogeneous, i.e., similar, antecedent moment which is the cause.

original: ste'u la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like the application of the axe, etc.

original: gcod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar byed pa'i ste'u la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar byed pa'i ste'u la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The axe, etc., which are applied to the cutting, etc., depend on a homogeneous antecedent moment.

original: nye bar len pa la ltos pa med pa can ni las la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa la ltos pa med pa can ni las la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: That which does not depend on the antecedent moment is like the application of the sound, etc.

original: stsogs pa'i gras ni sgra la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i gras ni sgra la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the sound, etc.

original: las la sogs pa la dang @315b por sbyor bar byed pa dag la 'dra ba'i skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las la sogs pa la dang @315b por sbyor bar byed pa dag la 'dra ba'i skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and the first application to action, etc., do not depend on a previous moment of the same kind.

original: gang yang sngar lan du ma mthong ba'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: gang yang sngar lan du ma mthong ba'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: And even if it is a thing that has not been seen before, and is thus a hidden object,üîΩit is not that the recognition of a hidden object, which is the awakening of memory later on, is a valid cognition, thinking, ‚ÄúThat is the very same thing.‚Äù

original: phyis dran pa sad pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa ngo shes pa tshad mar gyur pa ni ma yin mod kyi mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po las skyes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum ngo shes
analyzed: phyis dran pa sad pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig las de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa'i lkog tu gyur pa ngo shes pa tshad mar gyur pa ni ma yin mod kyi mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po las skyes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum ngo shes
translated: But that which arises from a thing that is present in front of one is a recognition that is direct perception.

original: pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: pa de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: And that recognition that is direct perception is a valid cognition of direct perception.üîΩAnd the thought that ‚Äúit is a valid cognition of direct perception that establishes the stability of things‚Äù is a recognition that is direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma de nyid las dngos po rnams kyi brtan pa sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems gang yin pa'i mngon sum du gyur pa'i ngo shes pa de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma de nyid las dngos po rnams kyi brtan pa sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems gang yin pa'i mngon sum du gyur pa'i ngo shes pa de yang 'og nas dgag par bya'o //
translated: And that recognition that is direct perception will be refuted later on.

original: phyogs 'dis brtan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dis brtan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: This is what is said in order to establish stability by this method.

original: rtags ngan gzhan yang sun dbyung bya //üîΩ'di ltar brtan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gang sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'ga' zhig kyang rigs mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rtags ngan gzhan yang sun dbyung bya // 'di ltar brtan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gang sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'ga' zhig kyang rigs mthun pa ste /
translated: Other bad omens are to be refuted in the same way.

original: dngos po brtan pa'i rang bzhin gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po brtan pa'i rang bzhin gcig gi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in order to establish stability, there is no such thing as a property that is the same kind of entity as that which is to be established, and which is concomitant with a single nature of stability.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: chos thams cad de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because all phenomena are just that kind of state.

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang gzhan nyams pa dang skyed pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: brtan par dam bcas pa thams cad kyang rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: ji skad du brjod pa ste ji skad du bstan bcos 'dir skad cig ma nyid du sgrub pa brjod pa dang brjod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa ste ji skad du bstan bcos 'dir skad cig ma nyid du sgrub pa brjod pa dang brjod par 'gyur ba'am /

analyzed: de'i sgrib par byed pa dang bral ba'am /

original: shes pa zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gsum ste /

analyzed: de la sgra rtag pa nyid kyi phyir phul du byung ba skye ba ma yin pa dang / sgrib par byed pa med pa ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa dang bral ba gsal bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs nas shes pa gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba lhag mar byas pa yin no // de'i tshe yang gsal ba'i go @316a * //
translated: In response to that, since the arising of the manifest is not due to the permanence of sound, and since the absence of an obscuring cause is not the effect, the absence of an obscuring cause does not manifest. Thus, having eliminated two alternatives, the remaining position is that consciousness is manifest.

analyzed: rims ngag yin na blo'i go rims ngag yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la blo ni skyes bu'i rten can min te skyes bu la brten pa can ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba dam bcas pa la gnod pa yin no //

analyzed: khas blangs mngon sum grags pa dang rjes su dpag pas cig car te dus gcig tu'o //

analyzed: rab tu grags pa nyid ni grags pas so //

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'o ;

analyzed: blo nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: blo rnams ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la skyes bus yon tan nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas assert that cognitions are uncreated by a person in their own philosophical tenets.

analyzed: khas blangs pas gnod pa 'dis kyang rang gi tshig gis gnod pa bsdus pa'i phyir so sor ma smos so //

analyzed: skyes bu'i yon tan zhes bya ba skyes bu tha dad pa'i yon tan yin te de ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de bas na yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag las skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu nyid du mngon sum du grub pa yin no //

analyzed: de skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub pa na mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no //
translated: When it is established that it is not produced by a person, it is contradicted by direct perception.

analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'gyur na 'bras bu nyid mngon sum ma @316b yin pa de bas na mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyi stobs kyis grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'o gnas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis also established by the power of perception‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThis will be explained later.

analyzed: med pa dngos su yul gyi ngo bo'i sgo nas mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on kyang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo dben pa'i dngos po nyid bstan pa'i stobs kyis med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir stobs smos pa byas pa yin no //

analyzed: de lta ma yin na mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no zhes de skad bstan par bya'o //

analyzed: blo yod pa dang med pa dag yin la de yod pa dang med pa de nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: blo rnams ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'bras bu nyid 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rtags can nyid yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i tha snyad ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: ci ste gsal ba'i go rims dag yin par mi 'dod kyi / 'on kyang yi ge'i go rims yin la /
translated: But if you do not assert that the order of the letters is the order of the manifestations,üîΩbut rather that the order of the letters is the order of the words,

analyzed: yi ge rnams las tha dad pa'i go rims kyang gsal ba zhes bya bar sngar bshad pa'i spyod pa gsal pos sngar tha dad pa med pa yang bkag @317a * //

analyzed: de bas na go rims de rtogs sgro btags yin 'gyur na de'i tshe /

analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin can ni de nyid dang gzhin  nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa de las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: blo'i sgrub pa ste bya bas so sor 'jog pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: yang dag par ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
