original: gzhan yang gtan du rtag pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtan du rtag pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because nothing has a permanent nature,

original: sgra yod cing snang bas gdon mi za bar gtan du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sgra yod cing snang bas gdon mi za bar gtan du ma yin pa ste /
translated: sound, which exists and appears, is not permanent without a doubt.

original: brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: sgra de yang rgyu med pa can nam 'di la skyes bu las bzlog pa'i gzhan gyi rgyu can yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: sgra de yang rgyu med pa can nam 'di la skyes bu las bzlog pa'i gzhan gyi rgyu can yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, that sound would be causeless or it would have a cause that is different from the person.

original: re zhig rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rgyu med pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: First, it is not causeless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu med pa can nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid ni gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if it were causeless, it would be permanent because it would not depend on another.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu can yin na yang skyes bu'i byed pa las 'gyur ba ma @317b yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu can yin na yang skyes bu'i byed pa las 'gyur ba ma @317b yin no //
translated: Even if it is caused by another, it is not a transformation from the activity of a person.

original: de bas na skyes bus byas pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bus byas pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is created by a person.

original: sgra'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: sgra'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The other‚Äôs is ‚Äúsound‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra'am sa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gtan du ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'am sa la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gtan du ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be understood that other things such as sound and earth are not permanent?

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa slob dpon gyi yin te /
translated: The master‚Äôs is ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig pa yod tsam 'brel pa can nyid kyi phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa nyid /
analyzed: 'jig pa yod tsam 'brel pa can nyid kyi phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa nyid /
translated: Because mere existence is related to it, sound is impermanent.

original: yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig par 'gyur gyi rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig par 'gyur gyi rgyu gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it exists, it is destroyed. It does not depend on another cause.

original: sgra yang yod pa yin pa de'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgra yang yod pa yin pa de'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Sound also exists. Therefore, it is impermanent. This is the summarized meaning.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan ni rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan ni rgyu 'ga' zhig las kyang 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The other thing called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù of things does not occur from any cause.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is so, therefore, means for that reason.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Things are destroyed by their very nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po nyid ni rang gi rgyu las de'i chos can te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni rang gi rgyu las de'i chos can te /
translated: Things are produced from their own causes as having the nature of that,

original: 'jig pa'i chos can du 'byung zhing skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can du 'byung zhing skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: as having the nature of destruction, because they arise.

original: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can kho na 'jig pa yin zhing de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa'i chos can kho na 'jig pa yin zhing de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is only things that have the nature of enduring for one moment that are destroyed, and they are produced from their own causes. That is the meaning.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid 'jig pa yin gyi sgra la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid 'jig pa yin gyi sgra la sogs pa rtag pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that whatever thing is accepted as impermanent is itself destroyed, and that sound, etc., are not accepted as impermanent,

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe destruction of things,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of a particular thing is not destroyed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it will be refuted later.

original: de bas na dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis te yod pa tsam rang bzhin gyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po tsam gyi rang bzhin gyis te yod pa tsam rang bzhin gyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the mere thing itself, by its intrinsic reality, is destroyed.

original: rgyu des na sgra'am gzhan yod pa nyid brten pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu des na sgra'am gzhan yod pa nyid brten pa ste /
translated: For that reason, sound and other things exist in dependence.

original: yod pa'i rten du gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa'i rten du gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad ni gtan du ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that all things that are the basis of existence are not permanent.

original: grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: grub pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is supplied.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'jig pa de nyid kyi gzhan las skye ba med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa de nyid kyi gzhan las skye ba med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the destruction of that thing itself is not established as arising from another.

original: gzhan las skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba'o //
translated: Arising from another.

original: gzhan las skye ba ma yin pa ni gzhan las skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba ma yin pa ni gzhan las skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Not arising from another is not arising from another.

original: de ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is not established.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is because the causelessness of destruction itself is not established.

original: de ltar na mes shing bsregs pa dang dbyug pas bum pa bcom pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu me la sogs pa shing la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la mthong ngo //üîΩde ltar na me la sogs pa yod na @318a * //
analyzed: de ltar na mes shing bsregs pa dang dbyug pas bum pa bcom pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu me la sogs pa shing la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la mthong ngo // de ltar na me la sogs pa yod na @318a * //
translated: Thus, we see that fire and so on are the causes of the destruction of wood and so on, for we say that fire burns wood and a hammer destroys a pot.

original: shing la sogs pa 'jig cing de med na 'jig pa med pa de ltar na 'jig pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'jig cing de med na 'jig pa med pa de ltar na 'jig pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yod pa yin no //
translated: If fire and so on exist, wood and so on are destroyed, and if they do not exist, they are not destroyed. Thus, the existence of fire and so on is concomitant with and recurs when there is destruction.

original: de yang rgyu de dang ldan pa ste rgyu dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par smra'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu de dang ldan pa ste rgyu dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par smra'o //
translated: We say that the existence of fire and so on is the characteristic of the cause of the destruction of wood and so on.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
translated: To respond: That is not so.

original: me la sogs pas shing la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skad cig ma snga ma rang gi ngag gis 'gag par 'gyur na mi 'dra ba gzhan te thal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo phyi ma skye ba'i phyir me la sogs
analyzed: me la sogs pas shing la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skad cig ma snga ma rang gi ngag gis 'gag par 'gyur na mi 'dra ba gzhan te thal ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo phyi ma skye ba'i phyir me la sogs
translated: Fire and so on do not cause the destruction of wood and so on. However, when the prior moment of wood and so on ceases through its own state, a subsequent state that is different from it, such as ashes, arises.

original: pa dag gis shing la sogs pa dag 'jig par tha snyad btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: pa dag gis shing la sogs pa dag 'jig par tha snyad btags pa yin gyi /
translated: and so on, are designated as the destruction of wood and so on,

original: 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because they cause destruction.

original: de'i mi 'dra ba gzhan skye ba yang gang las she na /
analyzed: de'i mi 'dra ba gzhan skye ba yang gang las she na /
translated: And from what is the arising of another different from it?

original: khyad par can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt arises from a special condition,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par can gyi rkyen me la sogs pa nyid la brten pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rkyen me la sogs pa nyid la brten pa ste /
translated: It arises from a special condition, such as fire, and so on,

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de dang sngar rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa'i nye bar len pa zhes tshig khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de dang sngar rang gi ngang gis 'gog pa'i nye bar len pa zhes tshig khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: and from the prior cessation of the appropriated aggregates through their own cessation.

original: yang na nye bar len pa'i ngag la khyad par can gyi rkyen me la sogs pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: yang na nye bar len pa'i ngag la khyad par can gyi rkyen me la sogs pa la brten pa ste /
translated: Or else, the special condition, such as fire, and so on, is in the appropriated aggregates.

original: lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba 'bru mang po par bya'o //üîΩme shing 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba 'bru mang po par bya'o // me shing 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúexisting‚Äù is a plural.üîΩIt is better to say that fire is the cause of the destruction of wood,

original: me las skye ba can gyi 'jig pa ste gang la me la skye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: me las skye ba can gyi 'jig pa ste gang la me la skye ba yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: because destruction arises from fire, that is, that which has arising from fire.

original: ci shing nyid dam 'on te shing las don gzhan du gyur pa yin zhes bya ba yang khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ci shing nyid dam 'on te shing las don gzhan du gyur pa yin zhes bya ba yang khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
translated: But if it is something different from the tree, then the tree would be seen.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med las don gzhan du gyur pa dag skye na shing ni mthong ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med las don gzhan du gyur pa dag skye na shing ni mthong ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If destruction were to arise without a cause and as something different from the tree, then the tree would be seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: shing ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tree would not be destroyed.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar shing don gzhan du gyur pa las 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa yin na shing 'jig cing nyams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar shing don gzhan du gyur pa las 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa yin na shing 'jig cing nyams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Why would it be so? If destruction were to arise as something different from the tree, then the tree would be destroyed and lost.

original: 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be destroyed.

original: gal te 'di ltar 'jig pa yin pa de ltar na yang don gzhan du 'gyur ba skye bas 'di mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar 'jig pa yin pa de ltar na yang don gzhan du 'gyur ba skye bas 'di mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is like this, then because destruction arises as something different, it is not seen.

original: mi snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi snang ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, It is not seen.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi snang ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi snang ba kho na yin no //
translated: Why is it not seen?

original: gal te don gzhan skyes pas don gzhan zhig pa'am mi snang ba de'i tshe de lta na shin tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don gzhan skyes pas don gzhan zhig pa'am mi snang ba de'i tshe de lta na shin tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one thing arises and another thing ceases or is not seen, then it follows that it would be completely illogical.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa gang la la 'ga' zhig skyes pa thams cad 'jig pa'am mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa gang la la 'ga' zhig skyes pa thams cad 'jig pa'am mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Any one thing that arises would be all things that cease or are not seen.

original: gal te de 'di 'jig pa yin zhes /
analyzed: gal te de 'di 'jig pa yin zhes /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis is the destruction of that,‚Äù

original: me las skyes pa'i don 'di shing 'di'i yin gyi thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @318b sdud par byed pa'i ngag de nyid gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: me las skyes pa'i don 'di shing 'di'i yin gyi thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @318b sdud par byed pa'i ngag de nyid gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: the statement that the thing arisen from fire is the destruction of that wood, but not of all things, is explained by the phrase ‚ÄúIf that thing itself‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te don de nyid me las skyes pa can gyi shing med pa ste /
analyzed: gal te don de nyid me las skyes pa can gyi shing med pa ste /
translated: If that thing itself, the wood arisen from fire, is the nonexistence, the destruction, of that,

original: 'jig pa yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir shing gi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir shing gi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir mi snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then because of that, that is, because of the destruction of the wood, it is not seen.

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated in the phrase ‚ÄúThat thing itself‚Äù and so on.

original: me las skyes pa'i don de'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: me las skyes pa'i don de'i med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is untenable to say that the thing arisen from fire is the nonexistence of that.

original: ming tsam yin pa de ltar na yang ji ltar gzhan ni gzhan 'jig yin /
analyzed: ming tsam yin pa de ltar na yang ji ltar gzhan ni gzhan 'jig yin /
translated: But even though it is merely nominal, how could one thing be the disintegration of another?

original: gang gi phyir don 'ga' zhig la me las skyes pa can gyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ming du byas pa tsam gyis shing mi snang ngo zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don 'ga' zhig la me las skyes pa can gyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ming du byas pa tsam gyis shing mi snang ngo zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: For it is not reasonable to say that a thing does not appear because it is merely nominally designated as ‚Äúdisintegration arisen from fire.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid 'jig pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid 'jig pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it just that which is well known in the world?

original: de'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba ming du byas pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba ming du byas pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not merely nominally designated as ‚Äúthe disintegration of that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: dngos po gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan ni gzhan gyi 'jig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Another thing is not the disintegration of another.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is absurd.

original: dngos po thams cad ni shing gi 'jig pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni shing gi 'jig pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: For all things would be the disintegration of wood.

original: de yang bshad ma thag nyid kyis gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang bshad ma thag nyid kyis gsal bar byed do //
translated: This is also clarified by the immediately preceding explanation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shing la don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis me las skye ba can gyi shing 'jig pa nyid du brtags pa dngos por gyur pa de ni de las gzhan pa ste bum pa la sogs pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis me las skye ba can gyi shing 'jig pa nyid du brtags pa dngos por gyur pa de ni de las gzhan pa ste bum pa la sogs pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The destruction of the fuel, which is a real entity, is imagined to arise from fire, because it is different from the fire. But this is no different from the case of a pot, etc.

original: gal te shing la mes byas pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin gyi bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ni ma yin pa de bas na thal ches pa med do //
analyzed: gal te shing la mes byas pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin gyi bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi ni ma yin pa de bas na thal ches pa med do //
translated: If you say that the destruction of the fuel is caused by fire, but not the destruction of all things such as a pot, then your argument is inconclusive.

original: shing la mes byas pa'i 'jig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shing dang 'jig pa dag gi 'brel pa gang yin /
analyzed: shing la mes byas pa'i 'jig pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shing dang 'jig pa dag gi 'brel pa gang yin /
translated: What is the relation between the fuel and the destruction of the fuel, such that you can say, ‚ÄúThis is the fuel, and this is the destruction of the fuel caused by fire‚Äù?

original: phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'brel ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa med pa'i phyir 'brel ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no relation, because there is no mutual benefit.

original: gal te shing ni brten ba yin la gang la rten yod pas na brten pa ste /
analyzed: gal te shing ni brten ba yin la gang la rten yod pas na brten pa ste /
translated: If you say that the fuel is the basis, and the destruction of the fuel is what is based on it,

original: 'jig pa yin pa de bas na rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa yin pa de bas na rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
translated: then there is a relation between the basis and what is based on it.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa de ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa de ni dgag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relationship between the support and the supported is itself to be refuted.

original: gal te 'jig pa ni bskyed par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa ni bskyed par bya ba yin la /
translated: If destruction is that which is to be produced,

original: de skyed par byed pa ni shing yin pa de bas na 'jig pa dang shing dag las skyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ni shing yin pa de bas na 'jig pa dang shing dag las skyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa yod do zhe na /
translated: and if the wood is that which produces it, then the relationship between the producer and the produced exists between destruction and wood.

original: me las zhes bya bas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: me las zhes bya bas ci zhig bya ste /

translated: If the killer, etc. anticipates the doubt of another,

original: nag pa gsod par byed pa gang yin pa de gal te gsod byed bsad pa na /
analyzed: nag pa gsod par byed pa gang yin pa de gal te gsod byed bsad pa na /
translated: If the killer of a black man is killed,

original: dper na nag pa yang srid min te nag pa gsod par @320b byed pa bsad pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nag pa yang srid min te nag pa gsod par @320b byed pa bsad pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: then the killer of a black man is not a non-existent like a black man.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: gsod pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa po nyid yin no //
translated: It is the killer.

original: de bas na de zhig pa na nag pa yang mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rigs te bsad pa log pa ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de zhig pa na nag pa yang mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni rigs te bsad pa log pa ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when that is destroyed, the black man does not arise. That is reasonable. The reversal of killing will come into existence.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: If, etc. explains that.

original: 'jig pa zhig tu zin kyang dngos po phyir thob pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa zhig tu zin kyang dngos po phyir thob pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Even if there were destruction, the thing would not be obtained again,

original: snga ma'i ngo bo thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i ngo bo thob pa ma yin no //
translated: that is, it would not obtain its former nature.

original: gang gi phyir gsod par byed pa bsad du zin kyang des bsad pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsod par byed pa bsad du zin kyang des bsad pa ste /
translated: Because even if the killer has already killed, he is not killed by that,

original: skyes bu gsod pa des bsad pa'i phyir skye ba ma yin no zhen lan 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gsod pa des bsad pa'i phyir skye ba ma yin no zhen lan 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because the person who kills is not born from the one who is killed. This answer is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skyes bus gsod par byed pa ni gsod par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bus gsod par byed pa ni gsod par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the person who kills is the cause of killing,

original: nag pa de bsad pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nag pa de bsad pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the cause of killing that black man.

original: gsod pa po 'di ni bsad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa po 'di ni bsad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: This killer is not of the nature of the killed.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says, ‚ÄúIf the cause of destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig pa rgyu me dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa log pa na dngos po zhig pa yang 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu me dang / dbyug pa la sogs pa log pa na dngos po zhig pa yang 'gyur ro zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that when the cause of destruction, such as fire or a stick, ceases, the thing that is destroyed also ceases.

original: de skad du brjod na ni de la lan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du brjod na ni de la lan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were said, it would be an answer to that.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?üîΩHow is it that fire, etc.

original: me la sogs pas shing la sogs pa'i dngos po med par byed pa gang yin pa de ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: me la sogs pas shing la sogs pa'i dngos po med par byed pa gang yin pa de ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: make things like fuel, etc.

original: shin tu dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ste /
analyzed: shin tu dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ste /
translated: nonexistent? It is said that it is characterized by utter nonapprehension.

original: las la yod pa'i bya ba 'di la dmigs pa de bkag pas shin tu mi dmigs pa nus pa thams cad dang bral ba la brjod do //
analyzed: las la yod pa'i bya ba 'di la dmigs pa de bkag pas shin tu mi dmigs pa nus pa thams cad dang bral ba la brjod do //
translated: The activity of the existent object is apprehended here. By negating that, utter nonapprehension is said to be devoid of all efficacy.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i med pa de log par gyur ba na rang bzhin gnas pa las rnam pa gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i med pa de log par gyur ba na rang bzhin gnas pa las rnam pa gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: When that nonexistence, which is such, is reversed, what other state is there than the natural state?

original: rang bzhin gnas pa kho na'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnas pa kho na'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is just the natural state.

original: gsod pa po zhig pa yang 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsod pa po zhig pa yang 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the killer perishes.

original: gang gi phyir nag pa'i gsod par byed pa ni 'jig pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nag pa'i gsod par byed pa ni 'jig pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the killer of a black man is not similar to a destroyer.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: It is similar to a club, etc.

original: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of destruction, like a stick, etc.

original: 'jig pa dang 'dra ba nag pa 'di bsad pa yin la de log pa na 'jig pa dang 'dra ba'i bsad pa 'di log pa na nag pa 'di 'byung ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang 'dra ba nag pa 'di bsad pa yin la de log pa na 'jig pa dang 'dra ba'i bsad pa 'di log pa na nag pa 'di 'byung ba nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If this destruction of the black were like the destruction of the pot, then when the destruction of the black were to cease, the black would arise again.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi skyon bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyi skyon bshad nas /
translated: Thus, first the error of destruction as a different object is explained.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad de 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩdngos po 'jig pa gzhan nyid ma yin na'ang shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur zhing rang gi rgyu las skye ba de yong nyid phyir rgyu can min te me la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig pa yang cung zad kyang byar med bas na rgyu med
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad de 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // dngos po 'jig pa gzhan nyid ma yin na'ang shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur zhing rang gi rgyu las skye ba de yong nyid phyir rgyu can min te me la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin gyi 'jig pa yang cung zad kyang byar med bas na rgyu med
translated: Now, in the case of non-difference of object, he says, Destruction, etc.üîΩIf destruction were not different from the thing, then the tree itself would be destruction, and it would not be caused, because it would arise from its own cause.

original: pa can yin no //
analyzed: pa can yin no //
translated: Since there is not the slightest destruction of the nature of fire, etc., it is causeless.

original: dngos po chos mi rtag pa la de nyid @321a * //
analyzed: dngos po chos mi rtag pa la de nyid @321a * //
translated: The impermanent thing is not the same as its impermanence,üîΩbecause it is the cause of impermanence.

original: dang gzhan nyid du brtags pa 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'ang med /
analyzed: dang gzhan nyid du brtags pa 'di las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'ang med /
translated: There is no other mode of examination than that of identity and difference.

original: shing las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad bar byed de /
analyzed: shing las zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad bar byed de /
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúIf it were fire, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe shing las 'jig pa don gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe shing de nyid der te 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shing las 'jig pa don gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe shing de nyid der te 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: If destruction were not a different object from the tree, then that tree itself would be the thing called ‚Äúdestruction.‚Äù

original: shing smos pas ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: shing smos pas ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of the tree is an illustration.

original: shing la sogs pa de yang me la sogs pa nye ba las sngar yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa de yang me la sogs pa nye ba las sngar yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And that tree, etc. would exist prior to the presence of fire, etc.

original: shing la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur ba 'di la me la sogs pa nus pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'jig par 'gyur ba 'di la me la sogs pa nus pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What would fire, etc. do to the destruction of the tree, etc.?

original: gzhung 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhung 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is the correct text,

original: shing gi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the context of the tree.

original: gzhung kha cig las dbyung ba la sogs pa'i nus pas zhes dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las dbyung ba la sogs pa'i nus pas zhes dbyung ba ste /
translated: In some texts, the reading is ‚Äúby the power of the removal, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang bum pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa byas nas bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bum pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa byas nas bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: And that should be explained after the prior mention of the pot, etc.

original: de bas na de la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te /üîΩshing la sogs pa de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te / shing la sogs pa de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it does not assist,üîΩbecause the causes of cessation do not assist that which is to be ceased,

original: shing la sogs pa de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dag la ltos par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa de rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dag la ltos par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: that which is to be ceased, such as a tree, does not rely on the causes of cessation in any way.

original: shing la sogs pa 'di me la sogs pas 'di 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'di me la sogs pas 'di 'jig pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical to say that this tree, etc., is the cause of the cessation of that tree, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: 'brel pa de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is based on the cause of assistance.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: phan 'dogs pa med par 'brel pa rtogs pa thal ches pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med par 'brel pa rtogs pa thal ches pa'i phyir te /
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that one would understand a relation without assistance.

original: thams cad thams cad kyi 'brel pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi 'brel pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Everything would be related to everything else.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa dngos su phan 'dogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i 'brel pa can du gyur pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pa dngos su phan 'dogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i 'brel pa can du gyur pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then fire would not directly benefit wood, etc., but it would benefit that which is related to it.

original: de'i phyir brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIf it benefits that which is related to it indirectly, etc.‚Äù

original: me la sogs pa shing la sogs pa'i 'brel pa can du gyur pa la phan 'dogs par byed kyi /üîΩdngos sum yin pa de lta na phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par rtogs pa na yang brgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de yang ci don gzhan du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: me la sogs pa shing la sogs pa'i 'brel pa can du gyur pa la phan 'dogs par byed kyi / dngos sum yin pa de lta na phan 'dogs par byed pa yin par rtogs pa na yang brgyud pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de yang ci don gzhan du gyur pa'am /
translated: Fire benefits that which is related to wood, etc., but not directly.

original: 'on te shing la sogs pa de nyid yin zhes gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te shing la sogs pa de nyid yin zhes gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /
translated: If it is understood that it benefits indirectly, then it must be ascertained whether that indirect benefit is a different object or whether it is just wood, etc.

original: rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: One must certainly follow this line of reasoning.

original: de las zhes bya ba shing la sogs pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur ba nyid na yang shing la sogs pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di'i yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba shing la sogs pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa don gzhan du gyur ba nyid na yang shing la sogs pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di'i yin no zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin /
translated: If the benefit is different from the tree, etc., then what is the relation between the tree, etc. and the benefit?

original: de la shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa po nyid brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la shing la sogs pa la me la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa po nyid brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The benefit of the tree, etc. by fire, etc. is to be examined and analyzed.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsogs pa'i sgras ni de las yang phan @321b 'dogs par byed pa gzhan rtogs pa de ltar na thug pa med pa'i skyon la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro // sogs pa'i sgras ni de las yang phan @321b 'dogs par byed pa gzhan rtogs pa de ltar na thug pa med pa'i skyon la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Because there is no relation other than that.üîΩThe word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the infinite regress of benefit, etc.

original: de ltar na phan 'dogs par byed pa de gzhan nyid ma yin na yang shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs kyis brgal zhing brtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phan 'dogs par byed pa de gzhan nyid ma yin na yang shing nyid 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs kyis brgal zhing brtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the benefit is not different from the tree, etc., and the tree, etc. would be destroyed, etc. This is the context of the examination and analysis.

original: de bas na yod pa de snang ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / dngos po de nyid dang gzhan de nyid las ma 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rgyus byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na yod pa de snang ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir dang / dngos po de nyid dang gzhan de nyid las ma 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rgyus byas pa'i phan 'dogs pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since that which exists does not go beyond the nature of appearance, and although that thing does not go beyond that which is itself and that which is other, still, it is said that that which is produced by the cause of destruction is not a thing.

original: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is helpful, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIt has the characteristic of establishing an entity.

original: dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the characteristic of establishing a thing.

original: de bas na dngos po de 'jig par byed pa des sam gzhan gyis byas pa gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa bshad pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po de 'jig par byed pa des sam gzhan gyis byas pa gnyi ga ltar yang nyes pa bshad pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, whether that thing is produced by that which destroys it or by something else, both are faulty, as has been explained.

original: de dang de ma yin par byed pa dang bral ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu byed pa po nyid ma yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhing dbyug pa la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa la yang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin
analyzed: de dang de ma yin par byed pa dang bral ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu byed pa po nyid ma yin pas na 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhing dbyug pa la sogs pa rgyu ma yin pa la yang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin
translated: Since it is not a cause of destruction that makes something be or not be, it is not a cause of anything. And even though a cause such as a stick is not a cause of the destruction of a vase, the vase has the character of being destroyed.üîΩ

original: pas na ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pas na ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not a cause of destruction that makes something be or not be, it is not the cause of anything. And since a vase and so on are by nature perishable, even though a stick and so on are not its cause, they are not dependent on anything.

original: de bas na rang yod pa tsam gyis dngos po 'di de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bas na rang yod pa tsam gyis dngos po 'di de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Therefore, this entity is by nature that which exists by its own mere presence.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub pa zhig nas med pa'i 'jig pa bzung nas gzhan gyis brgal ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar grub pa zhig nas med pa'i 'jig pa bzung nas gzhan gyis brgal ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having established that it is by nature perishable, BhƒÅviveka anticipates the objection of an opponent who holds that destruction is a nonexistent and says, ‚ÄúIf destruction is causeless, it would be permanent.‚Äù

original: gal te 'ang 'jig rgyu med pa can yin na rtag par 'gyur te /üîΩbdag nyid phyir yod pa'i tshe na yang 'jig par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te 'ang 'jig rgyu med pa can yin na rtag par 'gyur te / bdag nyid phyir yod pa'i tshe na yang 'jig par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If destruction is causeless, it would be permanent.

original: dngos po 'jig pa dag lhan cig 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa dag lhan cig 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were so, then it would follow that the destruction of an entity would occur simultaneously with it.

original: skyon ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The fault does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jig pa gang las med nyid rtag nyid yin /
analyzed: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jig pa gang las med nyid rtag nyid yin /
translated: Because the non-existence which is the characteristic of destruction is permanent.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: In this way, he explains with ‚ÄúIf it were so, etc.‚Äù

original: skad cig mar smra ba gang gis 'jig pa rgyu med can na yang de gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin pas na dngos po de med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: skad cig mar smra ba gang gis 'jig pa rgyu med can na yang de gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin pas na dngos po de med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: For the one who advocates momentariness, even though destruction is without cause, it is certainly permanent. Therefore, the characteristic of the non-existence of that entity is the characteristic of the non-existence of destruction.

original: 'jig pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / 'jig pa de med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / 'jig pa de med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The characteristic of the non-existence of that destruction is the characteristic of the existence of the entity.üîΩThe characteristic of the non-existence of that destruction is the characteristic of the existence of the entity.

original: dngos po bdog pa'i mtshan nyid can dag gcig la lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po bdog pa'i mtshan nyid can dag gcig la lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The characteristic of the existence of the entity is the characteristic of the non-existence of destruction. These two occur simultaneously in one.

original: de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: med pa de la dngos po med pa nyid kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos mi rung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang zhig gang la rag lus pa med pa de ni de las gzhan pa yin te /

original: rta las ba lang lta bu'o //
analyzed: rta las ba lang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cow is different from a horse.

original: phung po dag las gang zag kyang rag lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phung po dag las gang zag kyang rag lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The person is not dependent on the aggregates. This is a reason from the nature of things.

analyzed: gang zhig gang las chos tha dad pa de ni de las gzhan yin te /

original: dper na rta las ba lang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta las ba lang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cow is a different quality from a horse.

original: phung po dag las gang zag kyang chos tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid do //
analyzed: phung po dag las gang zag kyang chos tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid do //
translated: The person is a different quality from the aggregates. This is a reason from the nature of things.

original: gal te 'di ltar skye bas byas pa'i rag lus pa med pa de lta na yang phung po dag las gang zag gi shes pas byas pa'i rag lus pa yin no zhe na /

translated: If the person were not dependent on the aggregates in the sense of being produced by them, then it would be dependent on the aggregates in the sense of being known by them.

original: gang gi rtogs pas ni gang rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi rtogs pas ni gang rtogs pa ste /

translated: If there is the realization and comprehension of the meaning of non-erroneous, then definitely that appears. Even though that thing is not its nature, i.e., even though it is devoid of that cognition that is non-erroneous,

original: kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gang zag de ni bdag nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bas @327b rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: But if you think that even though it is suitable to appear, it does not appear, and therefore it is not nonexistent, and you assert that the person does not appear, then even the recognition of it

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa med na mi 'byung ba gang gang zag shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar na shes par byas pa'i rag lus pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa la rag las pa'i rtogs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zag tha dad par snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa la rag las pa'i rtogs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zag tha dad par snang ba ma yin no zhe na /

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
